address: 542 A Negombo Rd, Wattala 11300, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I recently visited Barista - wattala branch and had a wonderful experience. I tried their cappuccino, which was smooth and perfectly balanced. The strawberry mojito was refreshing, with a nice fruity twist that felt really up lifting.

For food, I went with the Kochchi chicken burger and absolutely loved the flavorful spicy kick, especially with the pol sambol that gave it a true Sri Lankan touch. The baby shrimp sandwich was another standout – fresh, tasty, and very satisfying.

The service was friendly, and the atmosphere was cozy, making it a great spot to relax or catch up with friends. Overall, it was a fantastic visit with delicious food and drinks. Definitely a place I’d recommend and look forward to visiting again!

address: 542 A Negombo Rd, Wattala 11300, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Hey there! As an entrepreneur juggling a wild mix of investments, I’m always chasing that chill vibe where I can kick back and sip a coffee with a buddy or a cool stranger I meet at a café. It’s my thing—grabbing a cuppa in random cities around the world, just soaking in the moment. But in Sri Lanka? Man, it was tough to find that perfect spot... until Barista Sri Lanka came into my life!

The Wattala branch, right by my place, has totally become my daily hangout. The crew there? Absolute legends. They’re serving up next-level vibes with smiles that make you feel right at home. Big shoutout to Thishan, Kevin,Ashen & Shehani—these guys are killing it with their energy and making every visit feel like I’m at some hip café abroad.

Cheers to Barista Sri Lanka for bringing that global coffee culture to our shores. Let’s keep the good times brewing and build an epic crew of coffee lovers right here in SL!

address: 542 A Negombo Rd, Wattala 11300, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Barista Wattala Diner has become my go-to daily spot and for good reasons. Whether you’re here to work, unwind, or catch up with friends, this place delivers on every front.

First off – Adrian. He’s a standout! (GEM as his badge says)  Always welcoming, attentive, and genuinely cares about each guest’s experience. His service alone makes every visit feel personalized. It's rare to find someone who remembers your regular order and checks in to make sure everything's perfect Adrian does that with ease.

 Budget-friendly? Absolutely. Great options that don’t break the bank, and the portion sizes are just right. You can grab a quality drink or snack without a second thought.

☕️ The menu is vast. From strong espresso shots to smooth frappés and creative seasonal blends there's always something new to try.

 Work-friendly? 100%. With accessible charging outlets, decent Wi-Fi, and a calm vibe, it’s a fantastic remote work or study hub. I’ve spent countless hours here with my laptop  and it never feels rushed or loud.

If you're in Wattala and haven’t dropped by Barista yet you’re missing out..

2 different Indoor seating areas plus outdoor all on the 1st floor .

address: 542 A Negombo Rd, Wattala 11300, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Had a great experience at Barista Wattala, where we tried the Iced Latte, Cappuccino, Cheesecake, and more.

☕ Iced Latte – Smooth and refreshing, with a well-balanced coffee-to-milk ratio. It wasn’t too strong or too sweet—perfect for a cooling caffeine fix.

☕ Cappuccino – Rich and bold in flavor with a creamy, frothy top. A good choice for those who love a well-made, strong coffee.

 Cheesecake – Creamy and indulgent, with just the right amount of sweetness. The texture was smooth, and the base had a nice crunch, making it a delightful treat.

✨ Ambiance & Service – The café has a warm and cozy atmosphere, making it a great spot to relax or catch up with friends. The staff was friendly and attentive, ensuring a pleasant experience. The service was prompt, and the overall vibe was welcoming.

 Overall Rating: 4.5/5 – Great coffee, delicious desserts, and a nice place to unwind. Definitely looking forward to visiting again!

address: 542 A Negombo Rd, Wattala 11300, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I recently visited Barista Wattala with my wife, and it was one of the most thoughtful and kind customer service experiences we’ve had. The cashier noticed that we looked tired and immediately suggested a comfortable seat for us. They even handed over the menu to make things more convenient. It was such a small but meaningful gesture that really made us feel cared for.

The service was prompt, efficient, and delivered with such a positive attitude. The manager was attentive, checking in to ensure everything was perfect, while the staff worked seamlessly as a team, creating a welcoming and relaxed atmosphere.
Hats off to the cashier and the server, for their attention and proactive attitude to ensure a great barista experience.

It’s rare to find a place where kindness and professionalism blend so effortlessly. Kudos to the Barista Wattala team for setting such high standards in customer service. I can’t wait to visit again! Highly recommended.

address: No 5 Main Street, Wennappuwa 61170, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I recently visited the newly opened Barista branch in my area, and it was a delightful experience from start to finish. The customer service was exceptional  the staff was incredibly friendly, making me feel right at home.

I tried the Winter Gingerbread Mocha, which had the perfect balance of spices and sweetness. It was the ideal drink to start my day. The Cheese and Tomato Sandwich was silky smooth, while the Forest Berry Iced Tea was refreshing and just what I needed. I also indulged in the Chicken Salami and Cream Cheese Simit, a flavorful and cheesy treat that satisfied my cravings.

Additionally, I had the pleasure of participating in their Share a Meal Campaign, supporting SOS Children's Village Sri Lanka. It was heartwarming to know that my visit contributed to a cause that helps children and families in need.

Overall, Barista Sri Lanka provided a fantastic experience – from the delicious food and drinks to the outstanding customer service. I highly recommend visiting this location for anyone in the area. I’ll definitely be back!

Thank you to Barista for the great experience, and a special thanks to SOS CV for the incredible work you're doing for children and families in need.

review_text:
I had a fantastic experience at this place! I ordered the smoked chicken sandwich and a coffee mocha, and both were absolutely delicious. The sandwich was packed with flavor and served fresh, and the coffee mocha was rich, smooth, and easily one of the best I’ve ever had. You can really tell they use quality ingredients and take pride in what they serve.

The prices were very reasonable for the quality of food and drinks, which made the experience even better. The staff were incredibly friendly, welcoming, and attentive, making me feel right at home from the moment I walked in. It’s clear they care about their customers and want everyone to have a great time.

The atmosphere of the place was warm and cozy with a modern, relaxing vibe. Whether you’re looking to catch up with friends, do some work, or just enjoy a quiet coffee break, this spot is perfect. I’ll definitely be coming back again—and I highly recommend it to anyone who loves good food, great coffee, and a chill environment.

address: 264, Henpitimulla Kandy Rd, Yakkala 11870, Sri Lanka
review_text:
A Cozy Coffee Haven in the Heart of Yakkala – Yakkala Barista Coffee Shop

Tucked away in the charming town of Yakkala, Yakkala Barista Coffee Shop is a delightful little spot that blends warmth, flavor, and community into every cup. From the outside, it’s inviting and calm—but step inside, and you’re instantly greeted with the comforting aroma of freshly brewed coffee and the friendly smiles of the staff who make you feel right at home.

The ambiance is thoughtfully crafted—modern yet cozy, with soft lighting, stylish decor, and a peaceful atmosphere that’s perfect for catching up with friends, reading a book, or simply enjoying a moment to yourself. Whether you’re grabbing a quick espresso or settling in for a lazy afternoon, the space is welcoming and unpretentious.

But let’s talk about the coffee—because that’s where Yakkala Barista truly shines. The menu features everything from rich, full-bodied cappuccinos to smooth lattes and refreshing cold brews. Each drink is made with care and consistency, using quality beans that bring out deep, well-balanced flavors. It’s clear the baristas here take real pride in their craft.

Pair your drink with one of their homemade pastries or snacks, and you’ve got a little moment of bliss. Every detail, from the presentation to the service, reflects a commitment to excellence and a love for good coffee.

Yakkala Barista Coffee Shop isn’t just another café—it’s a gem in the local community. A place where coffee lovers can feel understood, where conversations spark easily, and where every visit leaves you wanting to come back.

If you find yourself in Yakkala, this place is a must-visit. Great coffee. Great people. Great vibes.

A Hidden Gem in Yakkala!

Barista Café Yakkala is the perfect spot to relax with a great cup of coffee and some delicious food. The ambiance is cozy and modern, with both indoor and outdoor seating that makes it ideal for hanging out with friends, studying, or just unwinding.

Their coffee is top-notch (as expected from Barista), and the food menu has a nice variety. I highly recommend trying their blueberry cheesecake and the spicy chicken pasta – both were absolutely delicious!

Overall, this café is a wonderful addition to the area. Whether you're a coffee lover or just looking for a chill place to grab a bite, Barista Yakkala won’t disappoint.

review_text:
I usually come to Barista Yakkala for my freelancing work and client meetings. The team here is always friendly, welcoming, and helpful. The upstairs area is spacious and perfect for both work and relaxation. One side has 4-seater table arrangements ideal for working or casual meetings, while the other side has cozy couches and a more private seating area — great for spending time with loved ones or family.

There’s also a dedicated working table with a TV, and the best part is there’s no minimum order requirement to use it. Another big plus is the washroom — always clean and well-maintained. Highly recommended for both work and leisure!

address: Level 3, Bank of Ceylon Mawatha, Colombo 00100, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Barista World Trade Center is one of the best spots in Colombo if you want a quick coffee break or a place to sit down for a casual meeting. The location is perfect – right in the heart of the business hub – so it’s very convenient if you’re working around Fort or just visiting the WTC.

The ambience is modern yet cozy, with comfortable seating and a relaxed atmosphere despite being inside a busy commercial space. Their coffee is consistently good – rich, smooth, and served just the way you like it. The cappuccino and iced lattes are customer favorites, and they also serve a decent range of teas and snacks.

Staff are usually friendly and attentive, though service can be a little slow during peak office hours. Prices are slightly higher compared to smaller cafés in Colombo, but you’re paying for both quality and the central location.

Overall, a great spot for professionals, students, or anyone who loves good coffee with a city vibe. Perfect for a quick caffeine fix, casual meetings, or even just relaxing with your laptop.

address: Infront of police, Ahangama 80650, Sri Lanka
review_text: I ordered one cappucino on uber eats at 9am to be delivered 5 mins away. It is now 9:50 and the order on the app still says “order received” not even “preparing order” yet. If the delay was because there are no drivers around then I can understand that but you haven’t even started making the order for the app to even start looking for drivers. I tried to call the outlet with the number listed on here on Google but no answer. I don’t think the number is even in service. I ended up canceling my order on uber eats 50 mins after placing it. Uber even said that “right now there is no cancelation fee for my order” allowing me to cancel because they didn’t even start making the ONE CAPPUCINO I ordered in the 50 mins since the order was placed. It’s a shame, I was excited to have a coffee place I can order from every morning while WFH but since one coffee is too difficult to manage I will not be ordering from here again. Wasted an hour of my life, thanks!

address: 292, 1 High Level Rd, Pannipitiya 10230, Sri Lanka
review_text:
⭐ 0 Star

I am extremely disappointed with Barista. My family and I have been regular visitors for years, but today I experienced something completely unacceptable. For a take-away order, I was charged 10% of the bill as a “packaging fee.” When I checked an older dine-in bill, I noticed they also charge 10% as a service charge for dining in.

When I asked what this 10% packaging charge was for, the staff explained that it is for the paper cup! Charging a percentage of the entire bill is unreasonable and feels blatantly unfair.

It seems like a deliberate practice of applying a service charge like fee to take away orders under the disguise of a “packaging charge.”

I expressed my disappointment on the spot, but the explanation given made no sense. I also called the feedback number printed there for feedback, only to find that no one answers it, which makes the experience even more frustrating.

This incident has seriously damaged my trust in Barista. Customers deserve transparency and fair charging practices.
clean_review_text:
0 star

address: 292, 1 High Level Rd, Pannipitiya 10230, Sri Lanka
review_text:
The Barista outlet at Kottawa Makumbura is, in my experience, the first place I’ve seen that completely lacks respect and proper customer service.

From the cashier to the other staff members, there is absolutely no sense of discipline, courtesy, or respect toward customers. When such issues are raised, the so-called managers or persons in charge fail to acknowledge the staff’s mistakes and instead seem to justify their behavior, showing that the management has no proper control over their own team.

If anyone from the Board of Directors happens to see this, I kindly urge you to conduct a direct and honest inquiry into the operations of the Kottawa Makumbura Barista outlet.

There is no proper vehicle parking facility available, no active security personnel, and customers who come to enjoy a meal or drink here have to face multiple inconveniences.

It’s very disappointing to see a reputed brand like Barista allowing such poor standards to continue.

address: 292, 1 High Level Rd, Pannipitiya 10230, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Barista Kottawa – A Cozy New Spot for Coffee Lovers!

I recently visited the newly opened Barista Kottawa outlet, and it’s definitely a great addition to the area. From the moment I stepped in, the interior felt calm and inviting, making it a perfect spot to relax or catch up with friends.

The food was absolutely delicious—I tried their cheesecake and some shakes, and both were spot on! The cheesecake was rich and creamy, while the shakes were refreshing and flavorful. They really maintain the quality Barista is known for.

Another major plus is the huge parking space available for customers, which is a big convenience, especially in a busy area like Kottawa. The overall environment was super cool, making it an ideal place to hang out, work, or just enjoy a quiet coffee break.

If you’re looking for a new café to try, Barista Kottawa is definitely worth a visit!

address: 7, 2 Station Rd, Colombo 00400, Sri Lanka
7, 2 Station Rd, Colombo 00400, Sri Lanka
review_text: Barista Bambalapitiya, located at 7 Station Road, Colombo 04, is a cozy haven for coffee lovers in the heart of Colombo’s vibrant Bambalapitiya district. As part of Sri Lanka’s largest coffee chain, this outlet delivers a premium coffee experience with a warm, inviting ambiance. The interior, adorned with comfortable seating and eye-catching wallpapers, creates a perfect spot for work, casual meetups, or a relaxing brunch. Their signature cappuccinos and lattes, crafted with Lavazza beans, are rich and velvety, while the Nutella shake and blueberry cheesecake are indulgent treats. The menu also features tasty sandwiches, like the smoked chicken ciabatta, and spicy chicken pasta, though some find prices slightly steep (e.g., Nutella Shake at LKR 690). The staff, known for exceptional service, greets guests warmly and even offers thoughtful gestures like warm water for a cough. Open from 9 AM to 10 PM, the cafe’s free Wi-Fi and calm atmosphere make it ideal for lingering. Despite its smaller size, Barista Bambalapitiya’s quality coffee, delicious bites, and stellar hospitality make it a top pick for a memorable cafe experience in Colombo.

address: 311 Borella Road, 10150, Sri Lanka
review_text:
A Must-Visit Café in Athurugiriya – Barista

I had a fantastic experience at the Barista outlet in Athurugiriya, and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a cozy café with great coffee, delicious food, and friendly service.

The moment I walked in, I was greeted with warm smiles from the staff, who were extremely courteous and welcoming. They patiently assisted me with my order and even gave great recommendations, making the experience feel personalized.

The cappuccinos and lattes were exceptional, featuring beautiful latte art that added to the experience. The coffee had a rich, smooth taste with the perfect balance of flavors—neither too strong nor too light. The presentation was impeccable, served with brown sugar and neatly arranged on classic white plates, giving a premium feel.

The food was just as impressive! The grilled sandwiches were perfectly toasted, with a crispy exterior and a flavorful, well-seasoned filling. They complemented the coffee beautifully, making it an ideal breakfast or mid-day snack option.

The café itself has a comfortable and inviting ambiance, with clean, well-arranged seating. Whether you’re looking to relax, work, or catch up with friends, this place offers the perfect setting.

Overall, Barista Athurugiriya exceeded my expectations. The combination of high-quality coffee, delicious food, and exceptional customer service makes this outlet stand out. I’ll definitely be visiting again!

review_text:
I had a wonderful experience at Barista Bambalapitiya! I visited with a mild cough and was touched by the staff's kindness and attentiveness. They noticed my discomfort and immediately offered me a glass of warm water, which was such a thoughtful gesture.

The staff were incredibly friendly and helped me choose the perfect coffee that suited my taste. Their recommendations were spot on, and the coffee was delicious and comforting. The atmosphere was cozy, and the service was prompt, making it an overall delightful visit.

It's rare to find such attentive and caring service, and I truly appreciated it. Highly recommend this place for not just great coffee but also for the warm and welcoming staff who go above and beyond for their customers. Five stars all the way!

address: 7 CargillsSquare Welimada Rd, Bandarawela 90000, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Barista Bandarawela is one of the nicest coffee spots in town and a great place to relax after exploring the cool hills of Uva. The food and drinks are consistently good — coffee is rich, aromatic, and served at just the right temperature. Their snacks, pastries, and main dishes are freshly prepared and presented with care. I especially appreciate how the staff are always friendly, attentive, and quick to help, even when the café gets busy. The overall service is professional and welcoming, which makes the whole experience enjoyable.

The atmosphere feels warm and cozy, with a modern yet relaxed vibe that suits both travelers and locals. However, the only downside is that the space is a bit limited. When it gets crowded, seating can feel tight, and it’s sometimes difficult to find a quiet corner to sit comfortably. A little more room or better seating arrangements would make the experience perfect.

Still, despite the small space, Barista Bandarawela maintains high quality and excellent service. It’s definitely one of the better cafés in the area, worth stopping by for a good cup of coffee and a friendly chat. Highly recommended for anyone passing through Bandarawela who appreciates good food, good service, and a genuine coffeehouse atmosphere.
clean_review_text:

still despite the small space barista bandarawela maintains high quality and excellent service its definitely one of the better cafés in the area worth stopping by for a good cup of coffee and a friendly chat highly recommended for anyone passing through bandarawela who appreciates good food good service and a genuine coffeehouse atmosphere

address: 932/A Kotte Rd, Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte 10100, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I am writing to formally complain about a service issue we experienced at the Barista Ethul Kotte outlet during a recent visit.

The main issue relates to an incorrect order. We ordered one large hot chocolate and one medium hot chocolate. The medium hot chocolate was correct. However after reaching home we realized that the large drink was not hot chocolate. Instead it appeared to be a coffee item which we did not order. This was very disappointing as we specifically ordered hot chocolate and paid for it.

The second issue concerns the seating policy. We arrived at the outlet around 9.50pm. While placing our order we politely requested whether we could stay until around 10.30 pm to enjoy our drinks. A staff member informed us that customers are not allowed to stay after 10.00 pm and that the order must be takeaway only. However at the same time there were other customers seated inside the outlet who were allowed to remain. This felt unfair and inconsistent.

This is the second issue we have faced at this outlet and the overall experience has left us dissatisfied. As customers we expect correct orders fair treatment and clear communication from staff.

I kindly request that this matter be reviewed and necessary action be taken to prevent such issues in the future.

review_text: Barista Nawala has always been one of my favourite places to grab a coffee and relax. The ambience is cosy and inviting, with a separate area at the back and plenty of outdoor seating as well. They even have a meeting room which is perfect for small work discussions or quick catch-ups. The coffee is consistently great and the food is freshly prepared and tasty. Honestly, Barista feels like Sri Lanka’s own Starbucks and I love that it has become such a reliable spot to unwind or get some work done. The staff are super friendly, attentive and always welcoming. Clean washrooms are a big plus too. Overall, a go-to café in Nawala that keeps delivering every visit!

address: 61D Departure/Transit Area, Bandaranaike International Airport Katunayake, Negombo, Katunayake, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Terrible Experience – Would Give Zero Stars If I Could

I’m writing this review while eating at Fashion Café in Colombo International Airport (March 23, 2025, 4:10 PM). We ordered rice with red curry and an idli combo with coffee. With a flight to catch at 5 PM, we expected a quick and smooth experience—but it turned out to be a total disaster.

After waiting over 15 minutes with no food, I went to the counter to follow up. They finally brought the rice and curry—stone cold, with a tiny portion of lentil curry and a heap of dry rice. The idli combo didn’t come until much later, and even then, it arrived without the coffee. We had to ask again, and despite repeated reminders, the coffee never came. We eventually had to leave without it to catch our flight.

The food was tasteless and felt stale—especially the chutneys, which seemed like they were made yesterday. To make matters worse, the staff appeared to serve Caucasian customers with a smile and warm welcome, while completely ignoring us (fellow South Asians). This kind of discriminatory behavior is unacceptable.

Do not be fooled by the “Sri Lankan curry” name or airport location—this place is a waste of time and money. Bad food, even worse service. Avoid at all costs.

address: 446 Nawala Rd, Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte 11222, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Important Privacy Concern at Barista - Nawala Branch

As a regular customer of the Barista Nawala branch for over three months, I've consistently enjoyed it for work, breakfast, quick coffees, and to hangout with friends. However, I've recently become aware of a significant privacy issue: their CCTV cameras appear to be recording audio in addition to video.

There are no visible notices informing customers that CCTV cameras are in operation or, more critically, that audio is being recorded. Given that many of us often share sensitive personal information with friends and family in what we believe to be a private setting, this raises serious privacy concerns. The collection of audio without explicit consent or notification is a significant violation of customer privacy.

I hope Barista addresses this issue promptly by either disabling audio recording or clearly informing customers about it.

address: 446 Nawala Rd, Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte 11222, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Barista Nawala offers a cozy and welcoming ambiance, making it a great spot for coffee lovers and casual hangouts. Located in the heart of Nawala, this café boasts a chic, modern design with comfortable seating, perfect for unwinding or working on your laptop.

The coffee here is consistently good, with a variety of options that range from strong espresso-based drinks to refreshing iced coffees. The signature beverages, like their creamy cappuccinos and indulgent lattes, are well-crafted, balancing rich flavors with smooth textures. Their coffee beans are sourced well, and it's evident in the depth of flavor that shines through in each cup.

Aside from coffee, Barista Nawala also offers an impressive range of light bites, including pastries, sandwiches, and cakes. The chocolate croissants are a standout, flaky and perfectly paired with their hot drinks. Their sandwiches are fresh and generously filled, catering to both meat-lovers and vegetarians.

The service is generally efficient, with friendly staff who are attentive but not overbearing. It's a nice spot for both quick visits or longer stays, whether you’re catching up with friends or working remotely. One slight drawback is the occasional noise level, as the café can get busy during peak hours, but it’s not a major issue unless you’re looking for total quiet.

Overall, Barista Nawala provides a quality coffee experience, delicious food, and a relaxed environment that makes it worth a visit for anyone in the area. Whether you're a regular coffee drinker or just looking for a pleasant place to relax, Barista Nawala is a solid choice.

We recently visited your Seeduwa branch for the first time and were impressed by the overall ambiance. However, we would like to share a concern regarding our order of smoked beef sandwiches with cheese.
Initially, the cheese was missing, and after we had already taken a few bites, the sandwiches were taken back and returned to us with cheese added. While we appreciate the quick response, we felt that reusing the same partially eaten sandwiches and simply replacing the plate does not meet proper hospitality and food safety standards.

address: 932/A Kotte Rd, Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte 10100, Sri Lanka
review_text:
We visited Barista Café on a rainy day when the place was packed and seating was hard to find. Shout out goes to Sahan, who went above and beyond—he brought in tables from the outdoor patio and set them up just so we could sit comfortably. That kind of thoughtful service truly stood out and made our visit extra special.

The food and coffee didn’t disappoint either. I had the dark chocolate and it was absolutely amazing—rich and indulgent. I also tried the lemongrass rice. While the flavor of lemongrass wasn’t very distinct, the dish was still enjoyable, though there’s definitely room for improvement in that regard.

Overall, the warm service and great flavors made it a memorable experience. I’d definitely go back—hopefully on a sunnier day!

review_text:
Si vous cherchez une arnaque, ne ratez pas cette adresse !
Une vraie arnaque visuelle ! En vitrine, vous verrez de superbes photos de sandwichs, soigneusement collées à l'intérieur de vraies boîtes à sandwich… tout est pensé pour vous faire croire que c’est exactement ce que vous allez recevoir. Mais ne vous laissez pas piéger : une fois payé, on vous tend discrètement un sandwich minable, emballé dans un simple film plastique, qui n’a absolument rien à voir avec ce que vous avez vu.

J’ai aussi testé une sorte de samoussa, réchauffé au micro-ondes : immangeable. La texture était caoutchouteuse, presque plastique. Honnêtement, une expérience à fuir.

review_text: The Barista in the Bandaranaike International Airport departure lounge offers a decent selection of food and beverages, but prepare for sky-high prices. While the quality is good, the costs can be a shock, especially for travelers on a budget. A simple snack or drink can easily exceed what you'd pay elsewhere. If you're in a hurry and need a quick bite, it’s convenient, but be ready to spend more than expected. Overall, it’s a mixed experience—great for a quick pick-me-up but not ideal if you’re watching your wallet.

932/A Kotte Rd, Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte 10100, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I wrote a 1 star review about the Rajagiriya Barista. I vowed never to enter a Barista ever again.

But this Place changed my mine. 9.30pm, not many places to go to. This Barista was open supporting the businesses around.

The staff who greeted me was amazing. Forgive me for forgetting his name. He looked in to every detail of my order and brought back to me the magic that was lost from another Barista.

The sandwich I had was perfectly done and the coffee, he didn't make me spend on the big cup... I had the smallest, he recommended it - as it paired well with the sandwich - both flavour and sip to bite ratio.

Thank you once again for bringing hope back to my and Barista. It is the people that make the place.

Absolutely amazing experience at Barista Ethul Kotte! From the moment we walked in, the staff was extremely helpful, kind, and genuinely friendly. We came in to record a group project and honestly didn’t expect such incredible support—but the team went above and beyond. They helped us film multiple takes without hesitation, and their patience and encouragement made the whole process so much easier.

Special shoutout to Denuwan he was an absolute star! Denuwan and his team gave us the BEST service, always with a smile, and made sure we had everything we needed to get our filming done smoothly. Their positive energy and willingness to assist truly made our day.

We’re so grateful for the hospitality and can confidently say we’ll definitely be coming back for more.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!

address: 16/2A Main St, Battaramulla 10120, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Barista Café Battaramulla is a great spot to relax and enjoy a quality cup of coffee or any other beverage. The café has a pleasant, calm atmosphere that’s perfect for catching up with friends or even spending some quiet time alone. The coffee was well made and flavorful, and the food options available complemented it nicely.
The staff were friendly, attentive, and quick with service, which made the overall experience even better. The place is clean, comfortable, and well maintained. Definitely a Barista outlet with good service although recent and a nice place to unwind—I’d happily visit again and recommend it to others.

address: 16/2A Main St, Battaramulla 10120, Sri Lanka
review_text:
A cafe that was indeed needed to Battaramulla.

The interior is really spacious and a good place to hangout for a coffee break or even to do some work peacefully.

The staff is really friendly and helpful. Provides a good service.

The toffee nut latte was the best drink I’ve had from Barista and sad it’s only there for the festive season.

The Turkish smit bagel was good but the portion size was too small and didn’t feel worth the price. The pistachios cake was also too dry, doughy and lacked the pistachio taste.

The smoked chicken croissant was good. It was soft, buttery and full of flavor. Definitely something I would recommend

address: Battaramulla - Pannipitiya Rd, Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte, Sri Lanka
review_text: While the location is a little out of the way from Thalawathugoda junction, the consistent quality of their offerings remains impressive. I also discovered a delightful variety of cheesecakes; of the ones I tried, the blueberry was my absolute favorite. Although I wasn't particularly fond of the seating arrangement, the cappuccino and tuna-sandwich I ordered were both delicious and satisfying. The preparation did take a bit longer than I've experienced elsewhere, but overall, I would definitely recommend this place for a quick and tasty snack, especially if you're a cheesecake lover!

address: Battaramulla - Pannipitiya Rd, Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte, Sri Lanka
review_text:
The place is a quite old barista. But its quite nice.

The coworking situation is catered more towards solo workers rather than duos or groups who come to work together.

They have small single person sized tables (a lot of them) and some coffee tables that can accomodate groups. The tables are a bit warped and rickety but its cozy and cute.

Has 2 floors. The upper floor has quite a nice library with a good variety of books.

There is also a separated meeting room with an AC that can be rented for 2000rs per hour.

The service is good with a friendly and attentive staff.

The only issue is that the parking is a bit insufficient, we had to park on the roadside since the parking spaces were all taken up.

All in all, a nice space to work at. And would probably be an even nicer place to come with some friends who would enjoy just hanging out in silence reading a good book.

address: Battaramulla - Pannipitiya Rd, Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte, Sri Lanka
review_text:
**Barista Thalawathugoda**

Barista Thalawathugoda stands out not just for its quality coffee but also for its exceptional customer service. The ambiance is warm and inviting, with both indoor and outdoor seating options that create a relaxed and cozy atmosphere. Whether you're looking for a quick coffee stop or a comfortable space to work, this café offers a great experience.

The coffee is consistently well-prepared, with a smooth and rich taste that matches Barista’s signature quality. Their menu features a good selection of espresso-based drinks, teas, and refreshing beverages, along with light snacks, pastries, and sandwiches. While the food variety could be expanded, the existing options pair well with their drinks.

What truly sets this branch apart is the excellent service. The manager and staff go above and beyond to ensure customers feel welcome and satisfied. They are friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu, always willing to customize drinks or accommodate special requests. Even during busy hours, the team maintains efficiency while ensuring a pleasant experience.

address: Battaramulla - Pannipitiya Rd, Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte, Sri Lanka
review_text:
While I typically prefer a simple cup of coffee, I recently chose your establishment as a workspace. Unfortunately, my experience was marred by a significant disappointment regarding the lunch portion size.

Driven by hunger, I ordered the Thai Chicken Rice, priced at LKR 1120. The cashier assured me it was a generous serving, sufficient for one person. However, what arrived was profoundly underwhelming. The plate, though visually large, contained a mere saucer-sized portion of rice. To be precise, the rice was consumed in approximately three mouthfuls. I estimate I could have easily eaten five such portions.

This experience exemplifies the concerning trend of 'shrinkflation' often observed in Sri Lankan establishments. However, the disparity between the promised and delivered portion was exceptionally egregious. It was a portion that would be considered inadequate even for a young child.

I urge you to reconsider the portion sizes of your lunch offerings. Ensuring a reasonable and satisfying amount of food, commensurate with the price, is essential for client satisfaction and maintaining your reputation

review_text:
I’ve ordered from Barista several times through PickMe, and they still haven’t fixed the same issue. The staff don’t seem to know how to properly use the PickMe system they only accept the order, but they never mark it as ready even after the food is actually prepared.

Every time, I end up calling to remind them to mark it as ready. They tell me “it’s done,” but it still doesn’t show up on the app. Because of this, the delivery gets delayed for no reason.

It’s really frustrating and defeats the whole purpose of using a delivery app. Please train your staff properly on how to use PickMe and mark orders as ready when they’re actually ready. This keeps happening again and again, and it needs to be fixed soon.

review_text: Went to Barista on Stratford Avenue with friends for a relaxed afternoon over a cup of coffee. It was disaster from the beginning! When I pushed open the glass door to enter I nearly lost my balance as one of the staff suddenly appeared and yanked open the  from inside without any warning! Then spent a long time placing the order. The person at the cashier's desk seemed to be new to his job. We ordered chicken quiche which took a long time to be served. And finally when it did arrive the inside was rock hard. Straight from the freezer, not heated through! Then they offered sandwiches for the same price. There were so many staff around, busy over nothing. The washroom door was left open and the lady staff member was adjusting her hair at the mirror in view of all the customers! Horrible experience. Not all Barista are like this. This one needs to be improved, with trained staff.

address: 28 Stratford Ave, Colombo 00600, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I had an absolutely incredible experience at Cafe Mocha. From the moment I walked in, the warm and welcoming atmosphere made me feel right at home. The interior is beautifully designed — cozy yet modern — creating the perfect setting to relax, catch up with friends, or even enjoy some quiet time.

The staff went above and beyond to make the visit special. They were attentive, friendly, and genuinely seemed happy to serve, which added so much to the overall experience. It’s rare to find such a combination of professionalism and warmth in customer service.

As for the food, it was truly outstanding. Every dish was fresh, flavorful, and presented beautifully. The menu had a great variety, and the quality exceeded my expectations. I also loved the drinks, which complemented the meal perfectly.

Cafe Mocha has quickly become one of my favorite spots. Whether you’re looking for a place to unwind, enjoy a hearty meal, or simply treat yourself to something delicious, this café is a must-visit. I’m already looking forward to coming back again soon!

address: 90 Katuwawala Road, Boralesgamuwa 10280, Sri Lanka
review_text:
This place is a scam.

I have visited this Boralasgamuwa outlet 2 times. On my first visit, I paid for the food and plugged my laptop in to work, but their internet was slower than an old dial-up connection. I informed them, but they just ignored me and did their work. So I couldn't work and had to go to another outlet.

On the second visit, I check the internet speed before paying for food and drink. So I connected the laptop, but unfortunately, the internet isn't working this time. Went to the cashier and asked about the WIFi. Then the reply was that they don't have data and are not sure what time it will top up. Again, I went to the Piliyandala outlet as there's no point staying there anymore.

I called some of my friends who are close to this outlet, and they said they don't visit it because they always have Wi-Fi issues.

The whole point of visiting Barista is to do our work while having a coffee and eating some food. But what is the point if they don't have a proper internet connection?

address: PWDR Cafe (pvt). Ltd, Yaggapitiya, Kurunegala - Dambulla Rd, Kurunegala 60000, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Barista Kurunegala is a perfect stop, especially for travelers coming from Colombo towards the Dambulla side. The location is extremely convenient, situated right after the Yakkampitiya highway exit, making it easy to access without any detours.

The interior is very beautiful, modern, and well-designed, creating a calm and comfortable atmosphere. One thing I really loved is that they have books available to read, which adds a nice, relaxing touch—great for coffee lovers who enjoy a peaceful break.

The restrooms are super clean and well maintained, which is a big plus, especially for travelers. Parking is another strong advantage: there is plenty of parking space both in front of the building and on the left side, so parking is never a hassle.

When it comes to the food and coffee, there’s honestly no need to describe much—the quality is exactly the same high standard you expect from Barista Colombo branches. Consistent taste, good presentation, and reliable service.

Overall, Barista Kurunegala is an excellent place to stop, relax, and recharge during a long journey or even for a casual coffee break. Highly recommended for travelers and locals alike!

address: PWDR Cafe (pvt). Ltd, Yaggapitiya, Kurunegala - Dambulla Rd, Kurunegala 60000, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Great breakfast stop with friendly service

We stopped at Barista this morning for breakfast and coffee. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted by a staff member at the door who even helped guide us with parking.  A great first impression.

The place was quiet when we walked in, so service was fast. I ordered the chicken tikka masala sandwich and it absolutely lived up to the expectations. My companion ordered a sandwich as well and we were both impressed by the flavor and freshness. Definitely worth trying when you’re passing through.

Inside is air-conditioned and comfortable. The toilets are clean, though they don’t have a lock, something to keep in mind if you plan on taking your time.

Overall, a great spot with delicious food and friendly service. Highly recommend stopping by!

review_text:
Absolutely loved our visit to Barista on Dambulla Road! From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with warmth and genuine smiles. The atmosphere was cozy and inviting, and the coffee was just as amazing as the people.

Special shoutout to the manager, who went out of his way to welcome us personally, check in on how we were doing during our visit, and even bid us farewell with the same cheerful energy he greeted us with. It’s rare to see such genuine hospitality and attention to detail these days, and it truly made our experience feel special.

The staff were incredibly friendly, helpful, and attentive always ready with a smile and happy to assist. Whether you’re stopping by for a quick coffee or planning to sit down and unwind, this Barista location is a gem. Highly recommend it for the excellent service, great coffee, and even better vibes!

address: PWDR Cafe (pvt). Ltd, Yaggapitiya, Kurunegala - Dambulla Rd, Kurunegala 60000, Sri Lanka
PWDR Cafe (pvt). Ltd, Yaggapitiya, Kurunegala - Dambulla Rd, Kurunegala 60000, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I recently visited this outlet, and I must say, it was a wonderful experience. The ambiance is calm, relaxing, and not crowded, making it an ideal spot to unwind. The staff are incredibly friendly and welcoming, greeting you right at the door, which adds a personal touch.

The coffee here is great, with my all time favorite being the Caffe Mocha, rich and satisfying. However, I wasn’t a fan of their cappuccino, which didn’t quite hit the mark for me. The seating arrangement is well spaced, and the decor is pleasing, creating a cozy environment. The sofas and chairs are notably more comfortable compared to their other outlet in Kurunegala.

Speaking of that outlet, I wouldn’t recommend it as it tends to be crowded, noisy, and has limited space. This Barista location, however, offers a much better experience for those seeking comfort and a quieter atmosphere.

Also, don't miss their new pistachio cake! One of the staff members once recommended it to me, and I'm glad they did. It's easily the tastiest cake they offer and pairs perfectly with a Caffe Mocha.

Overall, a fantastic spot to relax and enjoy good coffee!

 Toilets need better cleaning and maintenance. This could significantly enhance the overall experience for customers.

Despite this, I’d definitely visit again for the great food and fantastic service. Keep up the good work, team Barista Kurunegala!

address: 27 S. De S. Jayasinghe Mawatha, Nugegoda 10250, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I have been a patron at Barista over a decade now. However, I have stopped going to Barista due to their exorbitant prices. In addition they Charge 10% of the bill value for packaging when you take-away even while visiting a store.

I have sent a personal message to CEO Dilupa in this regard. However, I believe the only way that people respond is when things get highlighted publicly, which is unfortunate, I reckon.

Are you specifically a Dine-In only Café? if not why 10% packaging?? Does your brown paper bag cost 10% of your product price? If so you should change the supplier, instead of burdening the customer.

I am so done with these businesses in Sri Lanka who thinks they can do whatever. You should travel the world and see how a sustainable business operates.

I know you will not change and will not mind losing a single customer. For me I rather go to starred hotel for more overall experience, rather scratching my head to find a parking spot at our esteemed Store! (Any store in that matter)

I have bills in case any one wants to peruse.

address: 90 Katuwawala Road, Boralesgamuwa 10280, Sri Lanka
review_text:
We visited Batista Boralesgamuwa for both office work and family time, and it was a great experience. This is a very comfortable place for official discussions as well as family visits.
We were warmly welcomed, and we ordered coffee and cheesecake. The food quality was next level, and everything was served by qualified, professional staff. The team was smiling, pleasant, and very attentive, which made the experience even better.
Many people visit this place for business discussions and quality family time, and the atmosphere perfectly supports both. It’s calm, well-maintained, and relaxing.
Overall, this is a perfect place for discussions and spending time with family in a nice atmosphere.
Highly recommended.

address: 90 Katuwawala Road, Boralesgamuwa 10280, Sri Lanka
review_text:
This place is a scam.

I have visited this Boralasgamuwa outlet 2 times. On my first visit, I paid for the food and plugged my laptop in to work, but their internet was slower than an old dial-up connection. I informed them, but they just ignored me and did their work. So I couldn't work and had to go to another outlet.

On the second visit, I check the internet speed before paying for food and drink. So I connected the laptop, but unfortunately, the internet isn't working this time. Went to the cashier and asked about the WIFi. Then the reply was that they don't have data and are not sure what time it will top up. Again, I went to the Piliyandala outlet as there's no point staying there anymore.

I called some of my friends who are close to this outlet, and they said they don't visit it because they always have Wi-Fi issues.

The whole point of visiting Barista is to do our work while having a coffee and eating some food. But what is the point if they don't have a proper internet connection?

review_text: Went to Barista on Stratford Avenue with friends for a relaxed afternoon over a cup of coffee. It was disaster from the beginning! When I pushed open the glass door to enter I nearly lost my balance as one of the staff suddenly appeared and yanked open the  from inside without any warning! Then spent a long time placing the order. The person at the cashier's desk seemed to be new to his job. We ordered chicken quiche which took a long time to be served. And finally when it did arrive the inside was rock hard. Straight from the freezer, not heated through! Then they offered sandwiches for the same price. There were so many staff around, busy over nothing. The washroom door was left open and the lady staff member was adjusting her hair at the mirror in view of all the customers! Horrible experience. Not all Barista are like this. This one needs to be improved, with trained staff.

PWDR Cafe (pvt). Ltd, Yaggapitiya, Kurunegala - Dambulla Rd, Kurunegala 60000, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Barista Kurunegala is a perfect stop, especially for travelers coming from Colombo towards the Dambulla side. The location is extremely convenient, situated right after the Yakkampitiya highway exit, making it easy to access without any detours.

The interior is very beautiful, modern, and well-designed, creating a calm and comfortable atmosphere. One thing I really loved is that they have books available to read, which adds a nice, relaxing touch—great for coffee lovers who enjoy a peaceful break.

The restrooms are super clean and well maintained, which is a big plus, especially for travelers. Parking is another strong advantage: there is plenty of parking space both in front of the building and on the left side, so parking is never a hassle.

When it comes to the food and coffee, there’s honestly no need to describe much—the quality is exactly the same high standard you expect from Barista Colombo branches. Consistent taste, good presentation, and reliable service.

Overall, Barista Kurunegala is an excellent place to stop, relax, and recharge during a long journey or even for a casual coffee break. Highly recommended for travelers and locals alike!

address: PWDR Cafe (pvt). Ltd, Yaggapitiya, Kurunegala - Dambulla Rd, Kurunegala 60000, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Great breakfast stop with friendly service

We stopped at Barista this morning for breakfast and coffee. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted by a staff member at the door who even helped guide us with parking.  A great first impression.

The place was quiet when we walked in, so service was fast. I ordered the chicken tikka masala sandwich and it absolutely lived up to the expectations. My companion ordered a sandwich as well and we were both impressed by the flavor and freshness. Definitely worth trying when you’re passing through.

Inside is air-conditioned and comfortable. The toilets are clean, though they don’t have a lock, something to keep in mind if you plan on taking your time.

Overall, a great spot with delicious food and friendly service. Highly recommend stopping by!

address: PWDR Cafe (pvt). Ltd, Yaggapitiya, Kurunegala - Dambulla Rd, Kurunegala 60000, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Barista Café – Kurunegala 2 is easily one of the best spots in town for a relaxing coffee experience. The atmosphere is modern, cozy, and perfect whether you’re catching up with friends or getting some quiet time with your laptop.

The coffee is top-notch — rich aroma, perfect temperature, and beautifully presented. Their Cappuccino and Iced Mocha are must-tries! The food menu has a nice variety too — everything is fresh, flavorful, and nicely plated.

What really stands out is the friendly and attentive staff. They always greet you with a smile and make sure you feel welcome. Service is quick, and the café is always clean and well-maintained.

Definitely my go-to café in Kurunegala for quality coffee, good vibes, and great service. Highly recommended! ☕✨

review_text:
Absolutely loved our visit to Barista on Dambulla Road! From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with warmth and genuine smiles. The atmosphere was cozy and inviting, and the coffee was just as amazing as the people.

Special shoutout to the manager, who went out of his way to welcome us personally, check in on how we were doing during our visit, and even bid us farewell with the same cheerful energy he greeted us with. It’s rare to see such genuine hospitality and attention to detail these days, and it truly made our experience feel special.

The staff were incredibly friendly, helpful, and attentive always ready with a smile and happy to assist. Whether you’re stopping by for a quick coffee or planning to sit down and unwind, this Barista location is a gem. Highly recommend it for the excellent service, great coffee, and even better vibes!

PWDR Cafe (pvt). Ltd, Yaggapitiya, Kurunegala - Dambulla Rd, Kurunegala 60000, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I recently visited this outlet, and I must say, it was a wonderful experience. The ambiance is calm, relaxing, and not crowded, making it an ideal spot to unwind. The staff are incredibly friendly and welcoming, greeting you right at the door, which adds a personal touch.

The coffee here is great, with my all time favorite being the Caffe Mocha, rich and satisfying. However, I wasn’t a fan of their cappuccino, which didn’t quite hit the mark for me. The seating arrangement is well spaced, and the decor is pleasing, creating a cozy environment. The sofas and chairs are notably more comfortable compared to their other outlet in Kurunegala.

Speaking of that outlet, I wouldn’t recommend it as it tends to be crowded, noisy, and has limited space. This Barista location, however, offers a much better experience for those seeking comfort and a quieter atmosphere.

Also, don't miss their new pistachio cake! One of the staff members once recommended it to me, and I'm glad they did. It's easily the tastiest cake they offer and pairs perfectly with a Caffe Mocha.

Overall, a fantastic spot to relax and enjoy good coffee!

review_text: Barista Delkanda is a comfortable spot to unwind with a good cup of coffee. The ambience is calm and welcoming, making it a nice place to catch up with friends, have a casual meeting, or simply enjoy some quiet time alone. The seating is decent and the place is generally clean and well maintained. The coffee lives up to the Barista brand standards, with a good selection of hot and cold beverages. Their snacks and desserts pair well with the drinks and are served fresh. Service is friendly and efficient, with staff being courteous and helpful even during busy hours. Overall, Barista Delkanda is a reliable café option in the area for consistent coffee, a relaxed atmosphere, and pleasant service. A good choice if you’re looking for a familiar café experience without the rush.

review_text:
The Barista outlet in Delkanda is a standout location that perfectly blends comfort and productivity. Like other branches, it maintains that familiar, excellent standard: very clean, consistently friendly, and wonderfully cozy—but the ample space here makes it a true gem.

Key Highlights & Criteria:

Atmosphere & Vibe: The environment is clean and cozy, providing a fantastic atmosphere for relaxation or focus. It offers ample space to chill and work, making it a highly recommended spot for Digital Nomads.

Service & Staff: The staff are a major asset. They are consistently very welcoming and friendly, enhancing the overall relaxed and productive experience.

Food Quality & Must-Try Combo: You truly can't go wrong with their classics!

The Go-To Order (Must-Try!): My highly recommended combination is the Café Latte, paired with a sweet and fluffy Blueberry Muffin, and the savory, satisfying Honey Roasted Chicken Sandwich. It's a foolproof order for a great mid-day break.

In Short:
Barista Delkanda is more than just a coffee stop; it's a comfortable office away from home. Come for the signature coffee and snacks, stay for the welcoming service, and enjoy the space perfect for settling in with your laptop!

The atmosphere is calm, clean, and perfect for both meetings and solo work sessions.

Great coffee, great service, and a great vibe overall. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a productive yet relaxing café experience!

address: No 601, Delkanda, Nugegoda 10250, Sri Lanka
review_text:
We visited Barista Delkanda and initially found there were no seats available. That’s when we were greeted by Mr. Thisith, who quickly made things work by adding a chair to a two seater arrangement simple, thoughtful, and very much appreciated.

We ordered a hot chocolate, ham and cheese Turkish simit, iced caramel macchiato, and a Milo shake. Everything was delicious as always. However, things took an unexpected turn when we accidentally spilled the entire hot chocolate all over the table and floor a complete mess.

I went up to the cashier to let Mr. Thisith know what had happened. He immediately came over, cleaned the area, and handled the situation with such understanding and kindness that it completely took away the awkwardness of the moment. After the cleanup, I went back to order another hot chocolate, since I hadn’t tasted a drop before the spill, but they insisted it was on them and gave me a new one for free.

That small but meaningful gesture absolutely nailed their tagline "Brewing Happiness". The atmosphere here is stunning, and the customer service goes far beyond expectations.

A must visit cafe in Colombo. Huge thanks to Mr. Thisith and the Barista management for taking the cafe experience to the next level.

review_text: One of the most spacious outlets in the Barista chain. You don't have to worry about parking plenty of parking slots available with a security guard also available to help you out while parking. Seats are very comfortable. Great place to hangout with friends or family or if you are a freelancer you can work at 2 designated areas with USB charging and plug point available tables. All items offered by Barista is also available at this outlet. Very clean toilets. An Outdoor Area is available if you are looking for a smoking area. Outlet has around 50 to 100 seating capacity. Good reading lights available if you enjoy reading along with a cup of coffee like me. It is actually an outlet that promotes and contributes towards reading, there are good books available to read in the sofa area on your right hand side as soon as you enter the premise. Large/High capacity AC units available to keep you nice and cool. Staff was friendly. Interior looks modern at the same time functional. I would recommend this outlet to anyone without any problem on anyday of the week.

address: No 601, Delkanda, Nugegoda 10250, Sri Lanka
review_text:
This is the newest and biggest Barista outlet between Delkanda and Wijerama Junction — and it’s impressive!

First impression: the parking! Finally, a café with plenty of space to park, and the security staff handles it really well. The moment you walk in, the interior is stunning – spacious, calm, and beautifully designed. It’s more than just a coffee shop; it feels like a cozy lounge or a second home.

The vibe is super relaxed. You’ll see couples chatting, students studying, and office teams working or meeting clients. The atmosphere is quiet, welcoming, and comfortable – perfect for both work and catch-ups.

The staff is warm and professional, making you feel truly welcome. After we finished our time there with chats, coffee, sandwiches, and cake, they even said, “Have a good day, sir. Please come again!” – a nice personal touch.

This was my second visit, and I’ll definitely be going again to work, meet friends, or have casual meetings. As always, coffee at Barista never disappoints.

Tip: Stick to their hot beverages – they’re great. Skip the cold drinks or juices, as those taste like regular store-bought ones.
Highly recommend trying their shrimp and pol sambol sandwich – absolutely delicious!

address: No 601, Delkanda, Nugegoda 10250, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Barista Delkanda is a cozy, vibrant space with beautiful interiors. It’s co-work friendly and a great spot to relax or get some work done. Coffee’s good, and the staff is friendly.

That said, I ran into two small issues. First, they mixed up our order—asked for a hot and iced Americano, but got a latte instead. We were okay with it, and they did offer to replace it, which was nice.

Second, while I was using the washroom, my half-finished iced Americano was mistakenly cleared. Again, staff apologized and offered to make a new one, but we were in a rush.

It seems like a new team still learning the ropes. No major complaints, just hope the service tightens up with time. I’d visit again.

review_text:
We Visited this outlet and ordered some food and drinks. The order took unusually long. The cashier said the order had not been placed, while the girl who took the order earlier said it would just take some time — which was quite confusing.

When I asked for the bill, both of them looked at each other suspiciously and said there was a “technical problem” and that bills couldn’t be issued, even though other customers were getting theirs. When I asked to speak with the manager, a person named Sahan said he was the manager and told us that if we didn’t like the service, we could leave.

This was a very disappointing experience. I strongly suggest that Barista management look into this matter before further actions are considered.

review_text:
This Barista branch in Nugegoda has quickly become my go-to place for everything. Whether I’m unwinding after a long day, spending quality time with my husband, catching up with friends, working, or studying, this place has it all.

What I love most about it is the peaceful and relaxing atmosphere. The friendly staff always make me feel welcome, and the cozy yet spacious interior creates a calming vibe. The modern design adds a touch of elegance, making it an inviting place to be.

With two floors available, there’s ample space to accommodate a crowd without feeling crowded. The upper floor features a pool table and an outdoor smoking area. And, of course, the coffee and food are consistently up to the high standards I’ve come to expect from Barista.

In short, this Barista branch truly lives up to its reputation and has become an essential part of my daily routine. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a great place to relax, work, or socialize!

address: 17 Pagoda Rd, Nugegoda 10250, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Barista Diner in Nugegoda has become my go-to spot, not only for coffee but also for peace of mind. As a regular customer, I often visit to study and relieve stress, and this place never disappoints. Their Americano, in particular, is my favorite — it always leaves me feeling calm and refreshed.

The team here is outstanding, and the credit goes to the manager, Mr. Dinesh, who is both professional and genuinely kind. He greets everyone warmly, whether you’re there for hours or just a short visit, and his friendly leadership keeps the branch feeling vibrant and welcoming.

Special mention also goes to Mr. Shivashanth, whose service is fast, attentive, helpful and thoughtful. He always knows how to balance professionalism with friendliness. Mr. Pasindu is also extremely helpful and approachable, ensuring every customer feels valued.

The rest of the staff are equally professional, cheerful, and consistently welcoming. The female staff members, in particular, never fail to greet customers with warm smiles that truly brighten your day and make any stress fade away.

With top-notch hospitality, delicious coffee, and an atmosphere that perfectly blends comfort and positivity, Barista Diner in Nugegoda is highly recommended. Go and experience it for yourself — you’ll want to come back again and again! ❤️✨

review_text:
My family and I visited this coffee shop today, and while there were some things to like, the experience ultimately left us disappointed. The atmosphere is genuinely nice, and the customer support was excellent, but honestly, you expect those things when you're paying a premium.

The most important part of a coffee shop is the coffee itself, and this is where it fell completely flat. The prices are extremely high—the smallest cup of coffee starts at 500 rupees, plus a 300 rupees service charge. For that price, we were hoping for a rich, flavorful experience, but what we got was just bitter. No one in our family enjoyed it, and for such a small serving, the price feels unjustified. It feels like they have huge profit margins on a product that doesn't deliver on quality. We even signed up for their loyalty program, hoping for some good offers, but were disappointed to find there were no vouchers or discounts to be had. It's frustrating when other restaurants give you big discounts without any membership at all.

To put the prices into perspective, you could go to an international fast-food chain and get better food, service, and atmosphere for the same price. While the ambiance and service are good, they're not enough to make up for the core product being so poor and overpriced.

address: 17 Pagoda Rd, Nugegoda 10250, Sri Lanka
review_text: As I am a daily barista customer, whenever I go, I usually go to every place where the barista is, and I had to face such a horrible incident in pagoda road barista. When me, my husband and the baby went there, there was no space upstairs, and we sat close to the restroom. So, while my hubby was in a meeting, I waited with my daughter and I noticed some teenage boys were going to the washroom every time and stammering something. Earlier, I ignored it, but then recently one boy went, and two boys again ran there and talked to him like he had taken drugs or some kind of thing which was dangerous. Then, after some time, the same 2 guys went inside the washroom and locked the door. I was quite uncomfortable because, these days, teenage kids are used to being baristas, and they study and have some of their time. Btw, they get badly influenced by such things because no one notices this and no one can do anything here.as a mom, I know my kids are also coming here, so I spoke to the staff and asked them to check and mean time. I spoke to the person who they had mentioned on the board with a name and a phone number. When I spoke to him, he was like," That's not my business. Different kinds of people are coming here, so it's not an issue for him. Btw, as a responsible citizen, I don't agree with this kind of stuff. Please be careful when you send your kids there because they might get badly influenced at any time.

review_text:
I have been a patron at Barista over a decade now. However, I have stopped going to Barista due to their exorbitant prices. In addition they Charge 10% of the bill value for packaging when you take-away even while visiting a store.

I have sent a personal message to CEO Dilupa in this regard. However, I believe the only way that people respond is when things get highlighted publicly, which is unfortunate, I reckon.

Are you specifically a Dine-In only Café? if not why 10% packaging?? Does your brown paper bag cost 10% of your product price? If so you should change the supplier, instead of burdening the customer.

I am so done with these businesses in Sri Lanka who thinks they can do whatever. You should travel the world and see how a sustainable business operates.

I know you will not change and will not mind losing a single customer. For me I rather go to starred hotel for more overall experience, rather scratching my head to find a parking spot at our esteemed Store! (Any store in that matter)

I have bills in case any one wants to peruse.

It’s more than just a coffee spot — with spacious seating, a welcoming atmosphere, and even boardroom facilities, it suits everything from casual dates to quick meetings. The staff is always friendly and attentive, adding to the overall experience.

review_text: Barista Delkanda is a comfortable spot to unwind with a good cup of coffee. The ambience is calm and welcoming, making it a nice place to catch up with friends, have a casual meeting, or simply enjoy some quiet time alone. The seating is decent and the place is generally clean and well maintained. The coffee lives up to the Barista brand standards, with a good selection of hot and cold beverages. Their snacks and desserts pair well with the drinks and are served fresh. Service is friendly and efficient, with staff being courteous and helpful even during busy hours. Overall, Barista Delkanda is a reliable café option in the area for consistent coffee, a relaxed atmosphere, and pleasant service. A good choice if you’re looking for a familiar café experience without the rush.

review_text:
We visited Batista Boralesgamuwa for both office work and family time, and it was a great experience. This is a very comfortable place for official discussions as well as family visits.
We were warmly welcomed, and we ordered coffee and cheesecake. The food quality was next level, and everything was served by qualified, professional staff. The team was smiling, pleasant, and very attentive, which made the experience even better.
Many people visit this place for business discussions and quality family time, and the atmosphere perfectly supports both. It’s calm, well-maintained, and relaxing.
Overall, this is a perfect place for discussions and spending time with family in a nice atmosphere.
Highly recommended.

address: 90 Katuwawala Road, Boralesgamuwa 10280, Sri Lanka
review_text:
This place is a scam.

I have visited this Boralasgamuwa outlet 2 times. On my first visit, I paid for the food and plugged my laptop in to work, but their internet was slower than an old dial-up connection. I informed them, but they just ignored me and did their work. So I couldn't work and had to go to another outlet.

On the second visit, I check the internet speed before paying for food and drink. So I connected the laptop, but unfortunately, the internet isn't working this time. Went to the cashier and asked about the WIFi. Then the reply was that they don't have data and are not sure what time it will top up. Again, I went to the Piliyandala outlet as there's no point staying there anymore.

I called some of my friends who are close to this outlet, and they said they don't visit it because they always have Wi-Fi issues.

The whole point of visiting Barista is to do our work while having a coffee and eating some food. But what is the point if they don't have a proper internet connection?

address: 28 Stratford Ave, Colombo 00600, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I had an absolutely incredible experience at Cafe Mocha. From the moment I walked in, the warm and welcoming atmosphere made me feel right at home. The interior is beautifully designed — cozy yet modern — creating the perfect setting to relax, catch up with friends, or even enjoy some quiet time.

The staff went above and beyond to make the visit special. They were attentive, friendly, and genuinely seemed happy to serve, which added so much to the overall experience. It’s rare to find such a combination of professionalism and warmth in customer service.

As for the food, it was truly outstanding. Every dish was fresh, flavorful, and presented beautifully. The menu had a great variety, and the quality exceeded my expectations. I also loved the drinks, which complemented the meal perfectly.

Cafe Mocha has quickly become one of my favorite spots. Whether you’re looking for a place to unwind, enjoy a hearty meal, or simply treat yourself to something delicious, this café is a must-visit. I’m already looking forward to coming back again soon!

address: 129/2 Dutugemunu St, Colombo 10250, Sri Lanka
129/2 Dutugemunu St, Colombo 10250, Sri Lanka
review_text:
It’s difficult to not be impressed with this location.
I’ve both dined-in and had take away from them, and both of my experiences exceeded expectations.
Having just landed in SL a couple of months ago, I was quietly on the hunt for a good cafe to be consistent with close to my home.
I was afraid establishments here might not meet the same standard as what I had abroad and that I would have to settle. Since every cafe I increasingly came across was either bad coffee or rude staff.
But not with Barista.
Their customer service is purely on another level, always so kind and patient.
Most importantly the care they take with the food.
If you order on uber eats the coffee doesn’t arrive half spilled and muffin half dry. Each item is carefully sealed with precautionary measures, so having it at home is just as good as having it at the cafe.
I’m so impressed and i thank the team at Barista Kohuwala with all my heart.
This will now be my go-to spot ahead of any other java or cafe.
Hats off to you.
Wishing you plenty more success.

review_text:
Cute little Barista outlet — smaller than the others but cozy enough.
Blueberry Cheesecake? Still the star of the show.
Milo shake? Delicious, but they clearly believe in minimalism when it comes to portion size.
The egg sandwich? Drier than my motivation these days. (And the filling was very less)
The service? Let’s just say I did the thanking.
Go for the desserts though.

address: 129/2 Dutugemunu St, Colombo 10250, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Barista Kohuwala, though a smaller outlet than usual, truly impressed me with its interior design – whoever is responsible deserves a raise! It's beautifully done and creates a very pleasant atmosphere.

The staff here are incredibly friendly and always have a smile on their faces, which really enhances the experience. Even the manager is very good and attentive. The service is definitely up to Barista's usual high standards.

My only slight observation, and it might just be me, is that the coffee machine seemed a bit "out of tune" on my last visit, as my iced americano tasted a little different than what I'm used to from other Barista outlets. However, this is a minor point.

Overall, it's a perfect spot for your daily coffee needs, offering a charming ambiance and wonderful service!

address: 239 Galle Rd, Moratuwa 10400, Sri Lanka
review_text:
The Barista is a truly inviting place, perfect for those seeking a relaxing and welcoming atmosphere. As you step inside, soft piano music plays in the background, creating a soothing ambiance that harmonizes beautifully with the delightful aromas wafting from the kitchen—freshly baked bread, sweet cinnamon, and rich coffee.

The menu boasts a tempting selection of delicious bites, ranging from flaky croissants stuffed with almond cream to hearty sandwiches filled with artisanal cheeses and locally sourced vegetables, all made with high-quality, organic ingredients. For those with a sweet tooth, the selection of pastries includes rich chocolate éclairs and seasonal fruit tarts that are as pleasing to the eye as they are to the palate.

The drink options are nothing short of mouth-watering, featuring expertly crafted espresso drinks with meticulously frothed milk, refreshing herbal teas sourced from around the world, and unique specialty beverages like lavender-infused lattes and spiced chai.

The overall atmosphere is not only warm and welcoming, with cozy nooks and comfortable seating, but also conducive to productivity, making it an excellent spot for working on projects or catching up with friends. With warm lighting cast from handmade fixtures and the soft murmur of conversation around you, The Barista is a haven for both relaxation and inspiration.

address: 28 Stratford Ave, Colombo 00600, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I’ve always appreciated Barista for its great service, but my recent visit to the Mocha outlet on 28th November 2024, around 2 PM, was disappointing due to the rude behaviour of the front security officer.

While waiting for a parking spot, I noticed him muttering something unpleasant. When I parked, he rudely told me to "leave space for bikes" even though I had already been considerate. Feeling disheartened, I decided to leave without visiting the outlet.

This experience was completely out of line with the warm and professional service I’ve come to expect from Barista. I urge the management to address this issue, as such behaviour can leave a lasting negative impression.

address: 28 Stratford Ave, Colombo 00600, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I recently discovered this charming little cafe tucked away in a quiet corner of Colombo. The ambiance is perfect for those seeking a relaxed and peaceful atmosphere. The coffee is rich and flavorful, and the food is equally delicious.

One of the things I loved most about this place is that there's no pressure to rush. You can linger as long as you want, whether you're working, reading, or simply enjoying the company of friends. The staff is incredibly friendly and attentive, always making sure that your needs are met.

To top it off, the crowd is very pleasant and well-mannered. It's a great place to people-watch and soak up the local culture. I even managed to snag a few great photos to remember my visit. If you're looking for a cozy and inviting cafe in Colombo, I highly recommend checking this place out.

review_text: Barista Pepiliyana has always been one of my go-to spots for a quick coffee catch-up or an informal meeting. The ambience is pleasant and relaxed. Perfect for conversations or even some solo downtime with a laptop. The coffee is consistently good, and their selection of snacks and light bites complements the experience well. However, one area that needs improvement is service efficiency. On more than one occasion, I’ve experienced noticeable delays, even when the café wasn’t particularly busy. It can be frustrating when a simple order takes longer than expected, especially when you're on a tight schedule or trying to fit in a short break. That said, the staff are generally polite and accommodating, and the location is quite convenient. With a bit more attention to speed and operational flow, Barista Pepiliyana could easily elevate its offering and customer experience.

review_text:
Barista – Mount Lavinia è un caffè eccezionale per chi ama bevande di qualità e un’atmosfera rilassante. Il caffè è preparato con grande cura, dal gusto intenso e aromatico, perfetto sia per una pausa veloce che per un momento di relax più lungo.
L’ambiente è accogliente, moderno e pulito, ideale per lavorare, leggere o incontrare amici. Il personale è cordiale, disponibile e sempre pronto a consigliare le specialità del giorno.
Inoltre, la selezione di dolci e snack è deliziosa e ben presentata, completando l’esperienza in modo eccellente. Barista Mount Lavinia è sicuramente un posto da visitare e dove tornerei volentieri: un vero 5 stelle per caffè e atmosfera!

review_text: I asked for a quarter strength latte take away. The female assistant did not greet when I said hello, I asked for the coffee to be take away. It was made it to a take away cup and the invoice reflected additional charge for preparation for take away. The coffee was not prepped for take away . I reminded the assistant that I needed the coffee take away. She gave me a look of discussed and walked away. Eventually I received the coffee prepared for take away, however , I expected better service especially when I paid Rs 850 for a coffee. I have been going to this shop everyday and received much better service from other staff. I will not return.
