address: Colombo road, Pepiliyana - Dehiwela Rd, 10290, Sri Lanka
review_text:
First, the coffee was quite disappointing. The coffee machine seemed to be out of tune, and the taste was noticeably off. It was not just my opinion; most people in our group who ordered different drinks felt the same way. I ordered a single shot, which is usually simple enough to get right, but even that tasted strange. One of us had an iced Americano, and it looked and tasted different from what we are used to as well.

On a positive note, the customer service was decent. The staff were polite and attentive, so there was nothing wrong in that area.

When it comes to the atmosphere, the place did not really feel like the usual Barista experience. Normally, Barista cafés have a cozy and inviting vibe, but this location felt different. I am not sure if the management is trying a new approach or if it was just an off day, but the space felt too tight and cramped. When it gets crowded, it becomes very noisy because the tables are placed very close together, making it difficult to have a proper conversation.

I heard they are planning to expand the space in the future. Hopefully, once that happens, the overall experience will improve.

For now, it is an okay spot if you happen to be nearby and just want a quick coffee, but it is not a place I would purposely choose to visit again until some changes are made.

address: Colombo road, Pepiliyana - Dehiwela Rd, 10290, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Barista Pepiliyana isn’t just a café; it’s a journey back in time, wrapped in the aroma of freshly brewed coffee. Set inside a beautifully restored colonial-style home, it exudes old-world charm with vintage architecture, soft lighting, and an effortlessly cozy vibe.

The ambience? Absolutely breathtaking. Imagine sipping your coffee in a space where sunlight filters through wooden windows, casting golden hues over rustic furniture and vintage décor. Whether you’re curled up in a cozy corner, enjoying the airy verandah, or taking in the serene courtyard, every inch of this café radiates a peaceful, nostalgic charm that transports you to another era.

It’s a place where time slows down, conversations flow effortlessly, and every sip of coffee feels like a moment of pure indulgence. The service is just as inviting; warm, genuine, and perfectly in sync with the café’s welcoming aura.

If you crave an escape from the ordinary, a space where history and coffee blend seamlessly, Barista Pepiliyana is an absolute must-visit. A hidden sanctuary where every cup comes with a side of nostalgia.

review_text:
In love with this place. The interior is graceful. Working tables with sockets makes it very convenient. Washrooms are squeaky clean. The environment is quite peaceful to get some work done. The smoking area is a narrow patio, yet another lively outdoor spot to chill.
Service is great, staffs are friendly and the food is served quite fast. ( clearing the tables is a bit slow, I was there from 2pm and my empty dish wasn’t cleared until I left at 6pm). AC is set at 22 C and it gets pretty cold out there after a while. Staffs were quite flexible to control the temperature when you inform.

Will visit again for the atmosphere and the service !

address: 35 Hill St, Dehiwala-Mount Lavinia 10350, Sri Lanka
review_text: I've been to almost every Barista outlet in Colombo, and this was by far the worst food I've been served.  I walked in  around 11am last Saturday and ordered a Caramel Macchiato and a Chilli Chicken Rice.  The Rice that was served 20 minutes later was cold, sticky and had an odd smell to it.  The Chilli Chicken was lukewarm.  It was clear to me that this meal wasn't freshly prepared.  I tried to eat a few bites, but the off taste from the rice was too much.  When I walked to the counter and asked about this, the staff member said that the food was fresh and new, which was an obvious lie.  I was frustrated, as I was quite hungry.  My coffee was not ready either.  I asked my coffee to be served immediately, and left.  Very disappointed that standards have dropped at Barista.

address: 35 Hill St, Dehiwala-Mount Lavinia 10350, Sri Lanka
35 Hill St, Dehiwala-Mount Lavinia 10350, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I am writing to express my disappointment with the service at this particular outlet. It’s my first time here and sad to say it wasn’t the greatest during my recent visit. Our order of five drinks was delayed by over 30 minutes, and only three were served without any clarification. Despite repeated follow-ups, we were kept waiting, and only after inquiring ourselves were we informed that the final drink could not be prepared due to a power failure which is understandable but not letting us know until a while and until we went and asked is unacceptable.

Additionally, the brownie cheesecake we ordered did not meet expectations, tasting more like a date cake. The drinks were really good.

As a regular customer, it is disheartening to encounter such poor service. I hope you will address these issues to improve the overall experience. Thank you

review_text:
I have been a regular customer at Hillstreet Barista for the past one year. I go there weekly 5 times and have always enjoyed the atmosphere and food.

However, yesterday was quite disappointing. I visited at 5:30 PM, placed my order, and waited patiently.  6:15 PM, and my sandwich still hasn’t been served.

The delay is unacceptable, and it has definitely impacted my experience here. I went to the counter and asked for a refund of the sandwich and that its been almost an hour.. the person incharge at the moment gave back the money for the sandwich and did not even apologise..

I hope the management addresses such service issues to ensure a better experience for loyal customers like myself in the future.

Then we come to the small batallion of flies inhabiting this place, I don't think anyone would be too fond of them, and I found their relentless attempts to dive in to my drink particularly irritating.

The location is rather inviting and has some undeniable colonial charm, which is the only reasion this place deserves even two stars!

address: 932/A Kotte Rd, Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte 10100, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I am writing to formally complain about a service issue we experienced at the Barista Ethul Kotte outlet during a recent visit.

The main issue relates to an incorrect order. We ordered one large hot chocolate and one medium hot chocolate. The medium hot chocolate was correct. However after reaching home we realized that the large drink was not hot chocolate. Instead it appeared to be a coffee item which we did not order. This was very disappointing as we specifically ordered hot chocolate and paid for it.

The second issue concerns the seating policy. We arrived at the outlet around 9.50pm. While placing our order we politely requested whether we could stay until around 10.30 pm to enjoy our drinks. A staff member informed us that customers are not allowed to stay after 10.00 pm and that the order must be takeaway only. However at the same time there were other customers seated inside the outlet who were allowed to remain. This felt unfair and inconsistent.

This is the second issue we have faced at this outlet and the overall experience has left us dissatisfied. As customers we expect correct orders fair treatment and clear communication from staff.

I kindly request that this matter be reviewed and necessary action be taken to prevent such issues in the future.

address: # 01 , Ella Junction, Ella 90090, Sri Lanka
review_text:
This place is a great place to enjoy the real taste of a cup of coffee. The surrounding has such a perfect, chill vibe—it's super comfy and a great spot to hang out for a while.
​The coffee quality is fantastic, and I was really impressed that they are providing variations of coffee on the menu. My drink was smooth, perfectly made, and tasted amazing.
​And also a quick nod to the barista, Chamara, who served me. He was really friendly and professional, and his excellent service definitely made the visit better. If you're looking for great coffee and a solid atmosphere, definitely check this place out!

address: # 01 , Ella Junction, Ella 90090, Sri Lanka
review_text: Wenn ihr schon Lavazza-Kaffee verkauft, dann sollte dringend jemand vorbeischauen, der auch weiß, wie man daraus Espresso macht. Der erste Versuch war wässrig, bitter und hatte nichts mit Espresso zu tun. Der zweite war zwar minimal weniger dünn, geschmacklich aber genauso katastrophal. In kleinen Straßencafés in Sri Lanka bekommt man auch Espresso, der Welten besser ist – hier dagegen absolute Fehlanzeige. Für ein Geschäft, das Lavazza führt, einfach nur enttäuschend.

address: # 01 , Ella Junction, Ella 90090, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Wir waren heute hier, um einen Kaffee zu trinken.
Leider war die Sojamilch verdorben (mit Stückchen im Kaffee), weswegen wir den Cappuccino reklamieren wollten.
Der Kellner wollte uns dann einen Aufpreis berechnen, da ich stattdessen Mandelmilch bestellen wollte.
Echt unverschämt, dass wir trotz vorheriger Bezahlung nochmal 500rs Aufpreis zahlen sollten für einen verdorbenen Kaffee. Kein Entgegenkommen o.ä., Service ist anders.

address: 932/A Kotte Rd, Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte 10100, Sri Lanka
review_text:
We visited Barista Café on a rainy day when the place was packed and seating was hard to find. Shout out goes to Sahan, who went above and beyond—he brought in tables from the outdoor patio and set them up just so we could sit comfortably. That kind of thoughtful service truly stood out and made our visit extra special.

The food and coffee didn’t disappoint either. I had the dark chocolate and it was absolutely amazing—rich and indulgent. I also tried the lemongrass rice. While the flavor of lemongrass wasn’t very distinct, the dish was still enjoyable, though there’s definitely room for improvement in that regard.

Overall, the warm service and great flavors made it a memorable experience. I’d definitely go back—hopefully on a sunnier day!

review_text:
I wrote a 1 star review about the Rajagiriya Barista. I vowed never to enter a Barista ever again.

But this Place changed my mine. 9.30pm, not many places to go to. This Barista was open supporting the businesses around.

The staff who greeted me was amazing. Forgive me for forgetting his name. He looked in to every detail of my order and brought back to me the magic that was lost from another Barista.

The sandwich I had was perfectly done and the coffee, he didn't make me spend on the big cup... I had the smallest, he recommended it - as it paired well with the sandwich - both flavour and sip to bite ratio.

Thank you once again for bringing hope back to my and Barista. It is the people that make the place.

review_text:
Absolutely amazing experience at Barista Ethul Kotte! From the moment we walked in, the staff was extremely helpful, kind, and genuinely friendly. We came in to record a group project and honestly didn’t expect such incredible support—but the team went above and beyond. They helped us film multiple takes without hesitation, and their patience and encouragement made the whole process so much easier.

Special shoutout to Denuwan he was an absolute star! Denuwan and his team gave us the BEST service, always with a smile, and made sure we had everything we needed to get our filming done smoothly. Their positive energy and willingness to assist truly made our day.

We’re so grateful for the hospitality and can confidently say we’ll definitely be coming back for more.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!

address: 53 Pedlar St, Street 80000, Sri Lanka
review_text:
This was a is a small haven of peace and calm away from the burning summer heat of Galle.
It is small and comfortably furnished and has excellent A/C and WiFi. There is also an outside, sheltered terrace from which to watch the world go by.
I paid only about R585 for a hot small sized Americano with hot milk. This is far cheaper than most other places in this rather over-priced (World Heritage) part of town.
There is a very good selection of Western-style sandwiches, pastries and cakes- all at very reasonable prices.
The workers were all really nice, welcoming and efficient.
Highly recommended.

address: 111 Old Matara Rd, Galle 80000, Sri Lanka
review_text:
The place was nice, the drinks were not bad. But Nadil who is probably the manager here has a “don’t care” attitude.

When I asked if the matcha strawberry latte also has coffee, he said “matcha thiyena nisa thamai latte” kiyanne. In a very “bossy” atitude. Actually Nadil, you are mistaken. Latte in Italian is milk and in generally accepted standards when you say latte it means a coffee drink with espresso and milk. What you said doesn’t even make sense. Why would anyone call something a latte because it has matcha?

And about macchiato, again you made another mistake. When my husband wanted a macchiato and I asked Nadil whether the macchiato has only a little milk (less than a cappuccino) like it’s supposed to in actual coffee standards, he gave some bs answer saying yes, and then saying it’s 110ml and then when I asked to show the glass, showed a tall glass which shouldn’t be a machhiato cup at all. Maybe here Barista brand is at fault, but you should know how to clearly explain what the drink is as a professional barista should.

While taking our order he also gave a rude order to one of the employees saying “athule inna dennagen ekkenekta ennna kiyanna”. He didn’t sound like a good boss at all. He was rude and was I think trying to display his authority to us, the customer. This was highly unprofessional.

Then when I was waiting for my friends to decide which cake they want, he looked frustrated and impatient. This happened twice when I had to ask him to show me the frappes in the menu too. For every question I asked he was impatient to get the order. As someone who’s visiting Sri Lanka after 3 years I’m not familiar with what’s on the Barista menu. Mind you there were no customers behind us too. In the end one customer arrived behind us and then we wrapped up the order quickly.

His behavior was unprofessional and he should get some sort of training on customer service. We also thought maybe he may have been frustrated due to lack of employees in the festive season (31st December 2025). But this doesn’t justify his attitude towards customers and there were only a few customers in the cafe.

P.S. the person who served us the drinks were super nice and professional. This is the only reason I gave 2 stars for service.

Attaching the drinks we got as proof of our visit.

review_text: Barista Galle Diner is my go-to chill spot when I’m around Galle. Super relaxed vibe, comfy seating, and good music in the background. review_text:
I had an excellent experience at Barista Horana! This café is the perfect spot to relax with a great cup of coffee in hand. The ambience is warm and welcoming, ideal for catching up with friends, working on your laptop, or just enjoying a peaceful break in the day. The staff are friendly and attentive, making the service quick and pleasant. Their coffee was rich, smooth, and brewed to perfection one of the best in the area!
The interior is clean and comfortable, with a cozy vibe that makes you want to stay a little longer. The food selection complements their drinks well, offering tasty snacks and light bites that pair perfectly with your coffee. Whether you’re stopping by for a quick caffeine boost or settling in for a leisurely coffee break, Barista Horana is definitely worth visiting. Highly recommended!

address: 111 Old Matara Rd, Galle 80000, Sri Lanka
review_text:
We visited the Barista branch on Old Matara Road in the evening during a meeting, and it was a very pleasant experience. The place is calm, clean, and beautifully maintained. Both indoor and outdoor seating options are available, creating a comfortable and relaxing atmosphere.

The team was very friendly, kind, and supportive, which made our visit even more enjoyable. The housekeeping standards are excellent, and the entire premises are well maintained.

Limited parking is available for about 4–5 cars, and additional parking can be conveniently managed along Old Matara Road without disturbing traffic.

Overall, a clean, attractive, and peaceful place to visit. Highly recommended! ☕

address: 53 Pedlar St, Street 80000, Sri Lanka
53 Pedlar St, Street 80000, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Food – 10/10
The Blueberry Cheesecake was absolutely delicious – creamy, rich, and full of flavor. I loved every bite!
Then I tried the Turkish Simit ( Chicken, Ham & Cheese ) – super crispy and tasty. Really impressed with the food overall.

Drinks – Not So Great (2/10)
Unfortunately, the drinks were a letdown. The Caramel Macchiato had too much sugar – it was overly sweet and hard to finish.
The Double Chocolate Frappe wasn’t any better – again, too sweet and not enjoyable. I wouldn’t recommend the drinks here.

Place & Atmosphere
The Galle outlet is quite small compared to the one in Nuwara Eliya. While the inside is okay, the outdoor seating needs improvement. They use sewing machine parts as table bases, and most of them are wobbly – not the best when you’re trying to enjoy your food.
It would be better if they added more cozy and comfortable seating outside. Also, weekends can get a bit noisy outside, so if you’re looking for a quiet, peaceful spot, this might not be for you.

But if you’re okay with a small, crowded place that serves really good food (but not drinks), Barista Galle is worth a visit.

Staff – 10/10
One thing I have to say – the staff here are amazing. They were fast, friendly, and way better than the team at the Nuwara Eliya branch. Big thumbs up for that!

In short:
✔️ Must-try food
❌ Skip the drinks
⚖️ Cozy? Not really
 Great staff

We decided to stop for a coffee here on a rainy day, and the cafe was packed with people sheltering from the rain.

From the outside, the place is quite eye-catching, but the interior feels a bit dull because of the dim lighting, I guess.

The coffee is fairly good compared to many other places we’ve tried, and it seems like they use Italian beans. However, the iced coffee was overly sweet, even though I requested an unsweetened version. It seems like the sweetness comes from a pre-mixed chocolate or milk powder.

Service was decent—the staff were polite and friendly.

address: 53 Pedlar St, Street 80000, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Disappointing and Unsafe Experience at Brista - Galle Fort

I visited Brista in Galle Fort on January 31st, 2025, and ordered a Milo shake. To my shock, I found a small metal string inside my drink, which looked like it was from cleaning equipment. This is completely unacceptable and raises serious concerns about hygiene and safety.

I have visited multiple Barista outlets recently, but this is the only place where I experienced something like this. It was very disappointing and made me question the cleanliness standards at this location.

When you visit a cafe, you expect basic hygiene and food safety standards to be followed. Finding a foreign object in my drink was not only disgusting but also dangerous. I hope the management takes immediate action to ensure better quality control in the future. Until then, I cannot recommend this place unfortunately

address: No. 249/A/A, LOT 4A, Ground Floor, Ratnapura Road, Horana 12400, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I visited Barista Horana for the first time, and honestly, it felt so special because we’ve been waiting so long for this branch to open. The place looks really modern and cozy, with a relaxing vibe that makes you want to stay longer. The seating area is comfortable, and the décor gives off a warm and welcoming feeling. It’s a perfect spot for friends to hang out, study, or just chill with a good cup of coffee.

The staff were super friendly and polite, and they greeted everyone with a smile. Even though it was quite busy, they managed to serve the customers quickly and efficiently. I tried their Hot chocolate  and a cheese croissant  — both were amazing. The drink was smooth, rich, and had the perfect balance of flavor. The croissant  was soft, fresh, and really delicious.

What I loved most was the overall atmosphere — it felt lively yet peaceful at the same time. It’s nice to finally have a Barista branch here in Horana where we can enjoy good coffee without traveling far. I’ll definitely be visiting again soon because it’s totally worth the wait!

address: 111 Old Matara Rd, Galle 80000, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I’ve visited Barista Galle twice, and both times were excellent.

Food – 10000/10: Blueberry Cheesecake, Death by Chocolate, Chocolate Brownie with Cream Cheese, Turkish Simit (chicken, ham & cheese), and the croissant were all mouthwatering. Must-try!

Drinks: (7/10)
Cappuccino was perfect (10/10)
Barista Blast was good (8/10)
Hot Chocolate average (6/10).So drinks are decent, but not as unforgettable as the food.

Atmosphere: (10/10) Super Spacious, cozy indoor seating with AC and a calm vibe, perfect for working. Outdoor area is also spacious and nice but chairs need better cleaning. Not crowded, quiet environment – I even met other work-from-café people.

Staff – 10/10: Super friendly, polite, fast. They greeted us warmly when we walked in and even said goodbye politely when we left that I didn't notice in Nuwara Eliya cafe as well as Galle fort cafe. Highly Appriciate

Facilities: Clean washrooms, and I really appreciate that they provide sanitary napkins (Fems brand) – It’s the first time I’ve seen that in a café here – such a thoughtful touch.

✅ Amazing food
✅ Great staff
✅ Good workspace
❌ Drinks could be better

I’ll definitely visit again.

address: 111 Old Matara Rd, Galle 80000, Sri Lanka
review_text:
One thing is certain—every Barista café shares two unbeatable qualities: exceptional coffee and genuinely friendly staff. Having traveled across Sri Lanka and visited numerous Barista outlets, I’ve been consistently impressed by their top-notch quality and service. In a country where ‘Nescafé’ is often mistaken for good coffee, Barista is a true lifesaver for discerning coffee lovers like us.

A special shout-out to the incredible team at Barista Galle—their amazing vibes and warm hospitality go above and beyond to delight customers. Huge thanks to Prasadi, Harshana, Malsha, Bimsara, and Akash for their outstanding service. Keep up the fantastic work—you’re setting the gold standard!

address: Barista, 7 Independence Ave, Colombo 00700, Sri Lanka
review_text: Barista Cafe – Independence Square is a solid spot to take a break, especially if you’re around the Independence Square area for a walk or some quiet time. The seating is comfortable with both indoor and outdoor options, and the surroundings are calm compared to most city cafés. Coffee quality is consistent with Barista standards, and the menu has enough snacks and light bites to go with it. Service is generally quick and staff are polite, even during busy hours. Prices are on the higher side, but you’re paying for the location and relaxed atmosphere. Good place to sit down, work on your laptop, or just enjoy a coffee after an evening walk.

address: 7, Third Floor, Block No. S-2, 420 Hospital Rd, Jaffna 40000, Sri Lanka
review_text:
We celebrated my wife's birthday at Barista Café in Jaffna and had such a lovely time! The two staff members there were extremely kind, friendly, and welcoming — they even offered to take some great photos for us, which we truly appreciated.

The drinks were amazing — we enjoyed delicious coffee and hot chocolate, and our kids loved the Milo milkshake. The cake was fresh and very tasty too!

The atmosphere was warm, and the service made us feel right at home. A big thank you to the Barista Jaffna team for making our day special. Highly recommended!

address: 7, Third Floor, Block No. S-2, 420 Hospital Rd, Jaffna 40000, Sri Lanka
review_text: We went to Barista Jaffna on 2 May 2025 to grab coffee when we visited Jaffna last week. The staff were very friendly. The quality of the food and coffee they served remained same throughout all their outlets which was a very good thing. The only concern that I had at Barista was the outlet not having a proper ventilation system. Barista Jaffna is located in the food court area of the Cargills Square building in Jaffna. When we went there to grab coffee, we noticed that the food court area doesn’t have any centralised AC. The entire area felt like it was boiling and we started to sweat like crazy. We initially thought to have coffee and the food we ordered inside but realising how hot the place was(they had a fan but it didn’t help at all), we told the staff that we would like to do takeaway. It was not just us who were suffering at that time, I also noticed that the staff were sweating a lot and suffering due to the excessive heat from not having an AC. But still they managed to serve us with a friendly smile. I think it’s time Barista should consider moving into a proper building in the neighborhood with clean washrooms (as the washrooms in the food court area were really bad).

and he totally did.

I ordered a cappuccino,and it came with the cutest little heart design on top. It honestly made me smile before I even took a sip. And the smoked chicken sandwich ? Oh my god- so good! Warm perfectly seasoned, and seriously cccomrting.

address: 118 Negombo Rd, Ja-Ela 11350, Sri Lanka
118 Negombo Rd, Ja-Ela 11350, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I’ve always loved the Lemongrass Chicken Rice at Barista, and it's been one of my go-to meals. But honestly, the experience has been really hit or miss. Almost half the time, there’s something wrong. Sometimes the rice is way too oily, other times the chicken barely has any gravy. Still, I kept ordering because when it’s done right, it really is delicious.

Whenever the rice was too oily, I didn’t complain. I just replaced it with my own rice at home and enjoyed the chicken. But today was a different story. The rice wasn’t just oily or dry. It was undercooked and completely inedible. I was really hungry, and as frustrated as I was, I still called and calmly explained the issue without being rude.

What happened next really upset me. The person on the phone asked the chef if there was anything wrong with the rice, and I could hear them say it was made like usual. That made me feel like I wasn’t being taken seriously. Why would I lie about rice being undercooked? What would I gain from that? It felt like I was being treated as if I was making it up.

I told the person on the phone that I’ve eaten rice my whole life. I can tell when it’s properly cooked. Eventually, she agreed to replace the meal and asked for my address. Since I live just five minutes away, I offered to send my location via WhatsApp so it would be easier to find me. She took down my number and said she’d message me.

The thing is, when you mess up someone’s breakfast, especially when they’ve been patient and loyal, the least you can do is fix it quickly. Instead, I’ve been left waiting with no message, no call, nothing.

I’m really disappointed with how this was handled, especially by the Ja-Ela branch. I won’t be ordering from here again. I don’t want a replacement now, and I don’t want anyone reaching out to me about this. I’ve already spent more time on this than I should have for a meal that should have been simple and enjoyable.

address: 679 Peradeniya Rd, Kandy 20000, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I’ve been visiting the Barista in Kandy regularly, and I have to say the experience is always special thanks to Mr. Dilshan. He’s the person behind almost all the coffees I’ve had there, and his dedication truly shows.

Every cup he makes feels unique — especially the coffee art, which is always elegant, creative, and done with so much attention to detail. The design he made on my drink is just one example of how much effort he puts into his craft. It’s not something you see every day.

Beyond the art, his service is friendly, consistent, and professional. It’s rare to find someone who enjoys what they do and makes the customer feel that passion with every cup.

If you’re visiting Kandy, definitely stop by Barista and ask for a coffee made by Mr. Dilshan — you won’t be disappointed!

address: 679 Peradeniya Rd, Kandy 20000, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I came here for a little date with my teenage daughter, but the experience was quite disappointing.

The air conditioner was broken, and there was an unpleasant smell coming from the restroom.

A large group of young people gathered, talking loudly and showing excessive affection, which made the atmosphere uncomfortable and inappropriate, hot, noisy, and far from hygienic.

For a café where the coffee and cake are relatively expensive compared to other local spots, I expected a much better atmosphere and level of service.

I also suggest finding a temporary solution for the broken air conditioner, such as using fans, and handling any repair work during off-hours.
The noise from the repairs was extremely disturbing, and since this is a place where people eat, creating a dusty environment is really not acceptable.

Unfortunately, this is not a place I would visit again.

address: 118 Negombo Rd, Ja-Ela 11350, Sri Lanka
review_text:
While I've always enjoyed Barista's coffee, my recent experience at the Ja Ela branch left a bitter taste in my mouth, and it wasn't just the espresso. I was shocked to find a parking fee added to my bill for a simple takeaway order. This is the first time I've encountered such a charge at any coffee shop, let alone Barista.
I understand that parking management can be challenging, but penalizing customers who are simply grabbing a quick coffee to go seems unfair. It discourages quick visits and leaves a negative impression.
The coffee itself was great, as expected from Barista, but this unexpected fee really soured the experience. I hope Barista reconsiders this policy for takeaway orders, as it could deter loyal customers.

review_text:
Barista easily ranks within the top 5 best cafes in Sri Lanka. The rich aroma of coffee instantly draws you in, while the peaceful ambience makes it a perfect place to unwind. It’s an ideal spot to focus on your studies, office work, or simply relax for hours, all while enjoying premium coffee and delicious snacks.

Their coffee selection is top-notch, with high-quality brews. During our visit, we tried Caffe latte and Green apple fizz.The Cafe latte was exceptional as usual, offering a rich flavor blending milk and cofee. It was my first time with a fizz and it gave a different authentic vibe.

As for the customer service, Barista delivers one of the best experiences I’ve encountered, which helps maintain its reputation as a leader among cafes in Sri Lanka. If you haven’t visited Barista yet, it’s a must-try. Looking forward to visiting again soon.❤️

address: 679 Peradeniya Rd, Kandy 20000, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Not the Barista experience I expected

I usually go to Barista to relax and enjoy a peaceful coffee break. Today, I was on a trip to Kandy and decided to visit the Barista here, hoping for the same vibe. Unfortunately, this location didn’t meet my expectations.

The place felt quite small and didn’t give the usual cozy Barista atmosphere. I ordered a latte, but it wasn’t good at all—definitely not up to their usual standard. The washroom was very small and had an unpleasant smell, which made the whole experience less comfortable.

Considering Kandy is a major city, I was hoping for a better Barista branch where people can unwind and enjoy their coffee in peace. Sadly, this one didn’t offer that.

address: 679 Peradeniya Rd, Kandy 20000, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I visited Barista Kandy with my wife recently, arriving by motorbike. Unfortunately, we had a disappointing experience even before we could step inside. The staff informed us that the parking area was only for cars and refused to let us park our bike there, despite the area being completely empty at the time.

Instead, we were asked to park in a spot directly under the hot sun where a person was actively collecting garbage—not exactly a welcoming or hygienic environment.

This kind of attitude from the staff was very disappointing and unprofessional. A brand like Barista should treat all customers with equal respect, regardless of how they travel. We expected better.
I do not recommend anyone to visit this place.

address: 679 Peradeniya Rd, Kandy 20000, Sri Lanka
review_text:
This was my first time at Barista and I really liked the vibe! The atmosphere was nice and cozy, though the tables were a bit too close to each other.

I tried the chicken and ham sandwich,it was so good, I loved it! The tandoori sandwich was just okay. I also had an almond milk coffee, but it was kind of bland and I didn’t like it. On the bright side, the blueberry smoothie was so good, super refreshing! And the Pistachio Dream cake was absolutely  amazing!

Customer service was great too, the staff were friendly and helpful. Overall, a decent experience. I’d go again and maybe try something else next time!

address: 679 Peradeniya Rd, Kandy 20000, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I have been going to Barista Express-Kandy since last three weeks for my morning espresso and I'm so happy to be there.This cozy coffee shop is a hidden gem, tucked away in Peradeniya road(kandy).

The atmosphere is warm and inviting, with comfy seating areas and plenty of natural light. It's the perfect spot to curl up with a good book or meet a friend.

But what really impressed me was the coffee. I always order espresso,and it was expertly crafted.The baristas clearly knew their stuff!

Friendly service, delicious coffee, and a charming atmosphere... what more could you ask for? Barista Express-Kandy has earned a loyal customer in me!

Recommended for: Coffee lovers, remote workers, anyone looking for a cozy spot for escape the city vibes,students etc.

address: 469B Kandy Rd, Kadawatha 11850, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Barista Kadawatha – Cozy Spot with a Great Vibe

Barista Kadawatha is a hidden gem if you're looking for a relaxed space to unwind or catch up on some work. The environment is spacious and modern, with a chill vibe that makes it perfect for both solo visits and small meetups.

One of the highlights is the small meeting room – ideal for quick work discussions or study sessions. There’s also a pool table, which adds a fun touch if you’re in the mood to unwind a bit.

The coffee is excellent as expected, and the cake and snack options are just right – tasty, fresh, and not overly priced. Whether you're here for a casual hangout or need a cozy corner to get things done, Barista Kadawatha delivers a great experience.

address: 05 E L Senanayake Veediya, Kandy 20000, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Barista Cafe is the place I always choose when I need an instant energy boost. The moment I step into any Barista outlet in Sri Lanka, the rich aroma of coffee itself refreshes my mind. Every visit feels the same—warm, welcoming, and comforting.

They always have delicious food and a wonderful selection of coffees, including all my favorites. Whether I want to spend time alone, take a short break, relax, or simply relieve stress, Barista is my go-to place. The interior design is beautiful, the music is calm and pleasant, and the overall atmosphere makes you want to stay longer.

What I love most is the way they care for their customers. There’s a genuine friendliness and consistency across all outlets that makes every visit special. No matter the time or reason, Barista Cafe is always the perfect place for me to relax and recharge.

address: 05 E L Senanayake Veediya, Kandy 20000, Sri Lanka
review_text: Barista's newest outlet in Kandy is a fantastic spot, strategically located right near Kandy City Centre (KCC)—making it the perfect refuge after a long shopping trip. I immediately fell in love with the cozy atmosphere and inviting interior design; it provides a much-needed calm oasis in the city. Their core offerings shine: the coffees are rich and perfectly brewed, and the accompanying pastries are fresh and absolutely delicious. Beyond the quality products, the service truly stands out. The staff provided a friendly and genuinely warm service, making every visitor feel welcome. Plus, for those who need it, the availability of a dedicated smoking area is a thoughtful touch. Highly recommend stopping by this new local favorite!

address: 05 E L Senanayake Veediya, Kandy 20000, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Barista Kandy is a great place to spend productive time while waiting between other tasks or meetings. It’s perfect for doing office work online, preparing lessons, or joining a Zoom meeting when you’re on the road. The environment is calm, clean, and comfortable — ideal for focus and relaxation.

The crew is always friendly and helpful, and the café is well-maintained with washrooms that are usually dry and tidy. It’s one of the few spots in Kandy where you can enjoy a good coffee and get real work done peacefully. Highly recommended for teachers, professionals, and travellers who need a quiet, clean space with reliable service. ☕

review_text:
I placed an Uber Eats order around 12:30 AM. The app clearly showed the outlet closes at 1:00 AM, and my order status stayed on “preparing” for 20–30 minutes.

Then suddenly, at 1:04 AM, the order was cancelled by the restaurant. If the kitchen was about to close or couldn’t fulfill the order, it should not have been accepted in the first place.

This wasted my time late at night and shows very poor coordination and customer service. Please manage closing times properly and don’t keep customers waiting only to cancel at the last minute.

address: WX35+87H, 390 Kaduwela Rd, Malabe 10115, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Barista Malabe got some tasty, yummy, mouth licking set of foods N beverages. Their customer service was also very nice N can't complain bout the atmosphere either. Not much space for a group of ppl to sit N dine but pleasant environment. The only thing u should be aware if ur going to get Ur breakfast, brunch, or just a coffee, that prices are very high. In my opinion it's too much.
Recently I got two ice coffee ( ice latte N ice caramel macchiato) n two sandwiches (smoked chicken sandwiches) it cost me around 5236/=... Which in my view is bit too much. They are overly charged Cafe. But at the end of the day know where you're going to eat N drink before u go N make complains bout their prices. address: WX35+87H, 390 Kaduwela Rd, Malabe 10115, Sri Lanka
review_text:
A place that truly respects women
I’m not a feminist, but one reason I deeply admire Barista is their thoughtful respect towards women. A simple box of sanitary napkins in the washroom with the message “Supporting you for a beautiful day” speaks volumes. For a woman going through the toughest days of the month, this small gesture means the world, especially when such support is rarely found elsewhere. It’s not just about coffee and sandwiches here; it’s about care, dignity, and a homely atmosphere. Salute to Barista for making a difference in such a meaningful way.

address: WX35+87H, 390 Kaduwela Rd, Malabe 10115, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Cozy yet the best!
Barista Malabe is the perfect spot to enjoy a hot coffee and a sandwich just the way you like it. The spacious layout offers a sense of privacy that’s hard to find elsewhere, making it ideal whether you're working, reading, or simply relaxing. From the warm welcome at the entrance to the friendly goodbye as you leave, the staff truly make you feel at home. Their service is both professional and heartfelt a rare combination. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a peaceful and satisfying café experience.

review_text: I am appalled by the utter incompetence displayed by Barista Malabe. I ordered a simple almond latte, but what I got was a ridiculously overpriced (1705LKR / $9 AUD for a paltry drink!) and poorly presented concoction that didn't even meet basic expectations. The staff's lack of knowledge about their own menu and pricing is inexcusable, and the fact that they're charging astronomical prices for subpar products is daylight robbery. The friendly demeanor of the staff is the only redeeming quality, but it's not enough to salvage this disastrous experience. I would strongly advise against wasting your money here.

review_text:
Love the vibe here, the staff is super friendly & nice, & even though the food is expensive, you can be sure of the quality since it's Barista standard.

The coffees are super awesome, & the meals are nicely varied.

Only thing is that the Cheese cake, which used to be rather affordable, is now comparatively rather expensive. Understandable, given our country situ, but still, as one of their fastest moving items in the past, a concession could've been considered for this item.

Only thing I've ever had to consider about is that the A/C on the upper floor doesn't work properly, which becomes even more painfully obvious when there is a crowd (it becomes very sweaty, especially during the afternoon, thanks to this).

address: WX35+87H, 390 Kaduwela Rd, Malabe 10115, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Excellent place to have a meetup, do some work or even just hang out. The ground floor has only two tables but the upper floor has a spacious and cosy room and another room for reservations so you can host a party as well. In addition, there is a seperate smoking area as well as a clean toilet. In the toilet, free sanitory pads were provided and it was the first time I saw that kind of regard for the customers. (The toilet is a common one)

The food is BARISTA quality!! Delicious as always. I tried ham and cheese sandwich, cafe mocha, nutella milkshake, blueberry muffin and classic mojito in Malabe outlet. All are exceptional in taste and looks.

I would highly recommend the Malabe outlet if you are looking for a place to chill with friends or get some work done.

review_text:
Located at the back of Cool Planet Maharagama with a very limited seating space. We tried dark hot chocolate, iced caramel macchiato and smocked chicken sandwiches.
Dark Hot Chocolate was amazing. It was rich and very chocolaty.
The Iced Caramel Macchiato was also good.  Had a rich caramel taste but the milk could be a little creamier.
Smoked Chicken Sandwich was heavenly. One of the best fillings I’ve had for a sandwich and it came with a perfect mix of smoky and tender chicken.
Staff happened to be very friendly and provided a real good service.

WX35+87H, 390 Kaduwela Rd, Malabe 10115, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Let me start with the positives... The customer service here is top notch. The staff are very courteous and helpful. They go out of their way for the patrons. The selection of food items is also very good and I think the pricing is very fair. There is ample parking located behind the café. It is possible to work/study here while having a meal or snack and there are ports available to charge mobile devices and free wifi.

There are a few negatives as well which can easily be ironed out. The place tends to get very crowded and the air conditioning just can not handle the restaurant at full capicity. Hence, it is very warm inside. The washroom is clean but I think it requires more regular cleaning as it smells very bad inside. Also, just the one washroom is not enough when the restaurant is at full capacity which it often is. While there are charging ports/power outlets available,  they are limited to just 2 or 3 tables. The restaurant might benefit from some expansion to the premises.

address: WX35+87H, 390 Kaduwela Rd, Malabe 10115, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Barista Malabe is our favorite spot for coffee and hot chocolate.  The staff are friendly and provide good service, especially once you become a regular.  It's a popular spot, so it tends to get busy in the mornings and afternoons, with many people working there throughout the day.  We usually prefer to sit downstairs as the upstairs area is almost always full.

Of all the Barista outlets I've visited, the Malabe location is the only one that consistently delivers a perfect hot chocolate.  The taste and quality are always the same, which is exactly what we're looking for.

address: WX35+87H, 390 Kaduwela Rd, Malabe 10115, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Excellent Experience at Barista Malabe

I recently visited Barista Malabe, and I must say it was an outstanding experience. From the moment I walked in, I was welcomed by a warm and friendly staff who made me feel at home. The ambiance was cozy and well-designed, making it a perfect spot for both work and relaxation.

The coffee was exceptional—rich in flavor, perfectly brewed, and served at the right temperature. I tried their cappuccino, and it had a great balance of espresso and frothy milk. Their menu also offers a good variety of snacks and desserts, and I particularly enjoyed their chocolate brownie, which was fresh and delicious.

What stood out most was the excellent customer service. The baristas were attentive, professional, and knowledgeable about the menu. They even recommended a customized drink based on my preferences, which I really appreciated.

The cleanliness and organization of the café were also impressive, creating a pleasant and hygienic environment. Whether you’re looking for a quiet place to work, catch up with friends, or simply enjoy a great cup of coffee, Barista Malabe is the perfect choice.

I highly recommend this place to all coffee lovers! I will definitely be visiting again.

address: WX35+87H, 390 Kaduwela Rd, Malabe 10115, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I recently visited this charming barista outlet and I must say, it was a delightful experience from start to finish. As soon as I walked in, I was enveloped in a sense of calm and coziness that instantly put me at ease. The warm smile I received from the staff added to the welcoming atmosphere of the place.

Whether you're looking to enjoy a peaceful moment alone, have a fun gathering with friends, a lovely family meal, or a romantic evening with your significant other, this spot caters to all. The variety of coffee and food options available are sure to please any palate, and I personally found them to be of excellent quality.

One unique feature that stood out to me was the opportunity to play the guitar while enjoying my coffee. It's not every day you come across a place that offers such a cool and creative outlet for its patrons. Additionally, the presence of a designated smoking area was a thoughtful touch for those who indulge, and the cleanliness of the washroom did not go unnoticed.

There is a parking lot behind the building which belongs to Barista, so you won't find it difficult for some parking space.

Highly recommended!

Barista in Matara town is a really nice spot to relax and enjoy a coffee break. The cozy vibe and comfortable seating make it a great place to unwind, whether you’re catching up with friends or working on the go. The café is clean, well-designed, and offers a pleasant atmosphere that attracts both locals and tourists visiting the area.

The menu has a separate Christmas variety of coffees and snacks, and the staff are friendly and welcoming. Its central location makes it easy to access, and it’s a perfect stop for travelers exploring Matara.

Overall, a charming café experience with a warm ambiance — definitely worth a visit! ☕✨

address: 07 Beach Rd Matara, Matara 81000, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Convenient location and nice vibe. I initially gave 3 stars since they got my order wrong. Then they have corrected it and offered a replacement. Which is the very best way to handle customer satisfaction.

During my second visit to the restaurant, on my holiday in Sri Lanka, we ordered an Oreo milkshake. My kid loves to have an Oreo milkshake and last time they got the order correct and it was perfect. During my second visit, a trainee did the order and apparently, there were no baristas to properly guide him. Also, the trainee was careless. The cashier told him the milkshake was for take away and he made it to have it there. Then he simply poured it into the takeaway container (which is absolutely fine if it was the right drink we ordered) and gave it to us.

Unfortunately, the drink was wrong. It was a plain chocolate milkshake and not an Oreo milkshake. I believe when trainees are making food and drinks, senior staff members have to make sure whether they have made it properly or not. Sadly, there was no quality control or check. I saw the trainee ask for ingredients several times and I didn’t see that the trainee got enough guidance to make the drink.
Finally, a huge disappointment for the kid. 

Later I visited there to get a new drink for my kid to console her and they offered me a free drink to rectify the issue. Which was a massive support from their end.

I attached the picture of my second drink
clean_review_text:

address: 07 Beach Rd Matara, Matara 81000, Sri Lanka
review_text: Quick feedback from today’s visit, the trainee on service was polite and attentive, really appreciated that. The space, however, was uncomfortably cold compared to the outside temperature. The AC was set to 22°C, but the trainee kindly adjusted it when I asked. The cashier, on the other hand, came off as egoistic and selectively welcoming. I came in with a guest and it felt like he was trying to act smart, rather than staying professional. Also, the ham sandwich was dry and overpriced for the portion. This café has potential, but the overall guest experience needs tightening.

address: 266 Old Kottawa Rd, Nugegoda 10250, Sri Lanka
review_text:
One of the newest Barista outlets in town and it feels really refreshing. It's a bit smaller than some of the other branches, but still cozy and inviting. A nice place to sit down for a coffee and catch up or get some quick work done.

The smoking area is on the smaller side though. Would be great if they could add a few more chairs out there. Other than that, the outlet is clean and looks well put together.

The best part is the staff. They’re super friendly and make you feel right at home. If you’re around Mirihana, this is definitely a solid spot to stop by for your caffeine fix.

address: Sri Ramya, Galle road, Mirissa, Sri Lanka
Sri Ramya, Galle road, Mirissa, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I came to Barista 3 times for hot Americano coffee during my stay in Mirissa.  Pros: 1. The coffee's taste was good (not too strong or weak). 2. The staff were polite - especially at the Mirissa location. 3. The seats at the cafe were comfortable and the widow seats provided a nice view of what was happening outside.

Cons:  10% Service Charge added to my bill without my being told by the staff. And is it normal to add a service charge to just a cup of coffee in Sri Lanka? For food, I understand this is a standard practice and can be expected by the customer. I think it would be a better business practice if Barista raised their drink prices by 10% on the menu instead of adding a10% service charge to the bill for a mere drink. Then, the customer knows upfront how much they should pay for a drink.

cons  10 service charge added to my bill without my being told by the staff and is it normal to add a service charge to just a cup of coffee in sri lanka for food i understand this is a standard practice and can be expected by the customer i think it would be a better business practice if barista raised their drink prices by 10 on the menu instead of adding a10 service charge to the bill for a mere drink then the customer knows upfront how much they should pay for a drink

address: Sri Ramya, Galle road, Mirissa, Sri Lanka
review_text:
My partner and I came to get a coffee here in the morning and was surprised at hoe amazing the place looks like ! It was super neat and the coffee tasted delicious, we ended up having breakfast and saw a monopoly board there and played a bit then left and came back in the evening , we kept playing monopoly for 2 more hours ! We felt right at home, the food is top notch and service was amazing , special thanks to Ashen for checking on us.

I highly recommend, this is the first coffee shop in sri lanka that we truly enjoyed this much !

address: 07 Beach Rd Matara, Matara 81000, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Filiale der, nach eigener Aussage, größten Kaffeekette in Sri Lanka.
Wenn einem der Sinn nach „westlichen“ Kaffeeprodukten steht wäre man hier gut aufgehoben. Leider ruiniert das Personal das Erlebnis ganz gründlich. Die Bestellungen wurden völlig konfus bearbeitet, ständig fragten Kunden an der Theke, wo ihre Bestellungen bleiben. Die Mitarbeiter laufen mit einzelnen Getränken auf der Suche nach dem Besteller hilflos durch den Laden. Am Ende hat man Kuchen ohne Kaffee oder Kaffee ohne Kuchen.
Nach der Erfahrung haben wir lieber richtigen Sri Lanka Kaffee getrunken.

address: 11 Galle Rd New Deviation, Moratuwa 10400, Sri Lanka
review_text:
We’ve always loved the Barista brand for its warm ambience and work-friendly vibe—especially at outlets like Boralesgamuwa and the tiny but cozy Katubedda Cargills Mall one, where the staff are consistently friendly, the environment is calm, and working for hours never feels like a hassle.

Unfortunately, our experience at the Moratuwa outlet didn’t quite live up to those expectations. The space itself is gorgeous—great interior, lots of natural light, and a really inviting upper floor. We first visited during a busy time and figured the noise was just a one-off. So we gave it another shot early in the morning, planning to get some work done.

But even then, the upper floor had two different types of music playing from separate speakers plus a TV playing a promotional video at the same time. It was extremely overstimulating. We politely asked if one audio source could be turned off and the volume lowered on the other (we were the only customers there), and while they turned one off, they refused to reduce the volume on the rest.

We moved downstairs, but it was still very noisy. The music volume was high and the baristas were unreasonably loud—banging things around and even singing along to the music. We've never encountered that at other Barista outlets, even the compact Katubedda one, where you’re seated right next to the counter and it still manages to stay peaceful and staff are considerate of the space.

The dismissiveness from the staff was the most disappointing part—they weren’t open to compromise or even a bit of accommodation, which really stood out in contrast to the service we’ve come to associate with Barista. In the end, we called the Boralesgamuwa outlet to ask if we could bring our food there and work instead—and as always, they were super welcoming and happy to help out.

All in all, Barista Moratuwa has so much potential thanks to its lovely setting, but the staff experience and ambience management seriously need some attention to make it as inviting and work-friendly as the other branches.

address: 11 Galle Rd New Deviation, Moratuwa 10400, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I’m really happy to have a Barista close to my home in Moratuwa. It’s a spacious and cozy place—perfect for hangouts, relaxing, studying, or even working remotely.

There’s also a pool table, so it’s a fun spot to spend time with friends. They allow one hour of pool table use if your bill is over Rs. 5,000.

While it has only a few dedicated parking slots, you can easily find parking along the nearby roads. It’s conveniently accessible from both New Galle Road and Old Galle Road, with entrances from both sides.

The staff is friendly and helpful, and the food is as good as always. A great addition to the neighborhood!

address: 11 Galle Rd New Deviation, Moratuwa 10400, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I was really disappointed with the newly introduced pistachio cake at Barista. As a regular customer who absolutely loves their blueberry cheesecake, I was excited to try something new — but this was a letdown.

The cake didn’t taste fresh at all. It was extremely cold, almost like it had been sitting in the fridge for too long. The texture and flavor felt off, and honestly, it made me feel a bit nauseous. I couldn’t finish it and had to leave it halfway through.

I hope Barista looks into the freshness and quality of this new item. Meanwhile, I’ll be sticking to my usual favorite, the blueberry cheesecake.

address: 11 Galle Rd New Deviation, Moratuwa 10400, Sri Lanka
review_text:
A wonderful spot with a calm and peaceful ambiance, perfect for various activities. Whether you're studying, working on IT, having meetings, or just hanging out, the environment is relaxing and enjoyable. The addition of a pool table is a nice touch.

The food was a bit disappointing. Some items on the menu were unavailable, and the quality of the dishes I tried wasn’t great. My ratings for the food are:
- Nutella milkshake: 2/5
- Honey Roast-White Sandwich: 3/5
- Smoked Chicken-White Sandwich: 2/5
- Iced Coffee: 3/5
- Iced Latte: 3/5
- Egg and Salad Croissant: 1/5
- Egg Salad Sandwich: 1/5

The ambiance makes it worth visiting, but the food experience could use some improvement. If you're going for the atmosphere and a casual hangout, it’s a great spot. However, I hope they work on their menu and food quality for a more satisfying experience.

No 313, 10 Avissawella Rd, Mulleriyawa New Town 10620, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Barista Mulleriyawa completely stole my heart the moment I walked in. The ambiance is everything; modern, peaceful, spacious, and so thoughtfully designed that I genuinely felt like staying there the entire day. It’s one of those rare places where you can relax, catch up with friends, or just enjoy your own company without a single worry.

The staff were super friendly and attentive, making the experience even more pleasant. They had just the right balance of professionalism and warmth, which made me feel very welcome from the get-go.

Now let’s talk about the food and drinks…I tried their cake, sandwiches, and of course, the coffee, and everything was fresh, and satisfying. Nothing over the top, just well-made comfort food done right.

Overall, Barista Mulleriyawa is hands-down one of my favorite places now. It’s perfect if you’re looking for a peaceful spot to unwind while enjoying good food and an even better vibe. I’ll absolutely be visiting again and probably more often than I should!

review_text:
Barista – Mount Lavinia è un caffè eccezionale per chi ama bevande di qualità e un’atmosfera rilassante. Il caffè è preparato con grande cura, dal gusto intenso e aromatico, perfetto sia per una pausa veloce che per un momento di relax più lungo.
L’ambiente è accogliente, moderno e pulito, ideale per lavorare, leggere o incontrare amici. Il personale è cordiale, disponibile e sempre pronto a consigliare le specialità del giorno.
Inoltre, la selezione di dolci e snack è deliziosa e ben presentata, completando l’esperienza in modo eccellente. Barista Mount Lavinia è sicuramente un posto da visitare e dove tornerei volentieri: un vero 5 stelle per caffè e atmosfera!

review_text: I asked for a quarter strength latte take away. The female assistant did not greet when I said hello, I asked for the coffee to be take away. It was made it to a take away cup and the invoice reflected additional charge for preparation for take away. The coffee was not prepped for take away . I reminded the assistant that I needed the coffee take away. She gave me a look of discussed and walked away. Eventually I received the coffee prepared for take away, however , I expected better service especially when I paid Rs 850 for a coffee. I have been going to this shop everyday and received much better service from other staff. I will not return.

address: 570, 1 Elvitigala Mawatha, Colombo 05000, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I visited this branch on January 16, 2026, around 4:20 PM. I clearly ordered two drinks:
• An iced Caramel Macchiato
• A hot hazelnut coffee

However, both drinks were made hot, which was not what I ordered. When I pointed this out and asked for it to be corrected, the barista refused and asked me to pay an extra 200 in cash to remake the drinks. I explained that I was willing to pay if required but only had a card, not cash. He still refused to help.

This is not the first time this has happened to me at different branches. Staff need better training to listen carefully and confirm orders before preparing them, and to handle mistakes professionally. Very disappointing customer service

address: 570, 1 Elvitigala Mawatha, Colombo 05000, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I come to Barista almost every day, and that alone says everything.
This place isn’t just about coffee—it’s about consistency, comfort, and professionalism.

The coffee quality is solid every single time. No shortcuts, no inconsistency—just well-made coffee and a calm, clean environment that makes you want to stay.

What truly sets this place apart is the team.
Dhanushi, Yenuka, Chanaka, Oshan, Adithya, and Shalini consistently deliver genuine, respectful service. They pay attention, remember regulars, and take pride in doing things right. That kind of service is rare—and it shows.

Barista has become part of my daily routine, not just a café I visit once in a while. If you’re looking for a place you can trust every day, this is it.

Respect to the entire team.

review_text: Barista Nawala has always been one of my favourite places to grab a coffee and relax. The ambience is cosy and inviting, with a separate area at the back and plenty of outdoor seating as well. They even have a meeting room which is perfect for small work discussions or quick catch-ups. The coffee is consistently great and the food is freshly prepared and tasty. Honestly, Barista feels like Sri Lanka’s own Starbucks and I love that it has become such a reliable spot to unwind or get some work done. The staff are super friendly, attentive and always welcoming. Clean washrooms are a big plus too. Overall, a go-to café in Nawala that keeps delivering every visit!

address: 446 Nawala Rd, Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte 11222, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Important Privacy Concern at Barista - Nawala Branch

As a regular customer of the Barista Nawala branch for over three months, I've consistently enjoyed it for work, breakfast, quick coffees, and to hangout with friends. However, I've recently become aware of a significant privacy issue: their CCTV cameras appear to be recording audio in addition to video.

There are no visible notices informing customers that CCTV cameras are in operation or, more critically, that audio is being recorded. Given that many of us often share sensitive personal information with friends and family in what we believe to be a private setting, this raises serious privacy concerns. The collection of audio without explicit consent or notification is a significant violation of customer privacy.

I hope Barista addresses this issue promptly by either disabling audio recording or clearly informing customers about it.

address: 446 Nawala Rd, Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte 11222, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Barista Nawala offers a cozy and welcoming ambiance, making it a great spot for coffee lovers and casual hangouts. Located in the heart of Nawala, this café boasts a chic, modern design with comfortable seating, perfect for unwinding or working on your laptop.

The coffee here is consistently good, with a variety of options that range from strong espresso-based drinks to refreshing iced coffees. The signature beverages, like their creamy cappuccinos and indulgent lattes, are well-crafted, balancing rich flavors with smooth textures. Their coffee beans are sourced well, and it's evident in the depth of flavor that shines through in each cup.

Aside from coffee, Barista Nawala also offers an impressive range of light bites, including pastries, sandwiches, and cakes. The chocolate croissants are a standout, flaky and perfectly paired with their hot drinks. Their sandwiches are fresh and generously filled, catering to both meat-lovers and vegetarians.

The service is generally efficient, with friendly staff who are attentive but not overbearing. It's a nice spot for both quick visits or longer stays, whether you’re catching up with friends or working remotely. One slight drawback is the occasional noise level, as the café can get busy during peak hours, but it’s not a major issue unless you’re looking for total quiet.

Overall, Barista Nawala provides a quality coffee experience, delicious food, and a relaxed environment that makes it worth a visit for anyone in the area. Whether you're a regular coffee drinker or just looking for a pleasant place to relax, Barista Nawala is a solid choice.

address: 48, IBM Building, Nawam Mawatha, Colombo 00200, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I’ve had two very disappointing experiences at Barista recently, and I feel compelled to share this.
A few weeks ago, after office hours, I visited the café to unwind after a stressful day at work. The café was crowded, so two customers who ordered after me sat at my table since there was no space. Surprisingly, their orders were served first. I waited patiently for over 25 minutes, only to find out later that my order hadn’t even been prepared.
When the drink finally arrived, it was extremely disappointing — filled mostly with ice, barely any coffee, and the milk tasted diluted with water. Considering the price, it felt like a complete waste, especially when I had come in hoping to relax after a long day.
Yesterday’s experience was even worse. After an exhausting month-end workload, I stopped by to buy sandwiches for dinner since no one was home. At the counter, I was told that no sandwiches were available, even though I could clearly see sandwiches displayed and being served to other customers. When I asked what was available, I was told “nothing.”
This left me feeling extremely uncomfortable and disheartened. I couldn’t help but wonder if I was treated differently because I came straight from work — tired, simply dressed, and not “fashionably” presentable. Whether intentional or not, the experience felt unfair and discriminatory.
This café is located in a business park, meant to serve all hardworking professionals, not just those who look polished or dressed a certain way. A customer is a customer, regardless of appearance.
Sadly, this has been one of the worst café service experiences I’ve had. I hope the management takes this feedback seriously and ensures fair, respectful treatment for everyone.

address: 48, IBM Building, Nawam Mawatha, Colombo 00200, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Kiosk ordering makes the entire process quick, smooth, and completely hassle-free, setting a great tone from the moment you arrive. It removes unnecessary waiting time and makes ordering very convenient, especially during busy hours. The customer service that follows is top-notch, with staff who are attentive, efficient, and genuinely pleasant throughout the visit. They ensure everything runs seamlessly and make you feel well taken care of.

The food is consistently satisfying—well prepared, thoughtfully plated, and clearly made with quality ingredients. Every dish feels fresh and enjoyable. The coffee is excellent and crafted with care, making it a perfect companion whether you’re working, relaxing, or catching up with friends.

One of the highlights of this café is its beautiful lakeside view. Facing the lake adds a calm, refreshing atmosphere that instantly elevates the experience. The space itself is clean, spacious, and thoughtfully designed, with a variety of seating options that suit different needs. Whether you’re there to work, read, hold meetings, or simply unwind, the environment feels comfortable and welcoming.

Overall, this café strikes a perfect balance between convenience, quality, and ambience. It’s easily one of the best cafés I’ve visited in Colombo and a place I’d happily return to again and again.

Highly recommended

review_text:
I’ve ordered from Barista several times through PickMe, and they still haven’t fixed the same issue. The staff don’t seem to know how to properly use the PickMe system they only accept the order, but they never mark it as ready even after the food is actually prepared.

Every time, I end up calling to remind them to mark it as ready. They tell me “it’s done,” but it still doesn’t show up on the app. Because of this, the delivery gets delayed for no reason.

It’s really frustrating and defeats the whole purpose of using a delivery app. Please train your staff properly on how to use PickMe and mark orders as ready when they’re actually ready. This keeps happening again and again, and it needs to be fixed soon.

Definitely a lovely café to stop by if you’re around Negombo!

review_text:
Absolutely the best Barista branch I've visited!

Barista Nawam Mawatha branch truly stands out from all the other locations I’ve been to. From the moment you walk in, you're greeted with a warm and welcoming atmosphere. The interior design is modern, cozy, and very well thought out – it’s a perfect spot to work, relax, or catch up with friends. Every corner has been designed with care, and it really adds to the overall experience.

A very special mention must go to Fuzle and the entire staff – their incredible customer service and outstanding dedication is truly commendable. They go above and beyond to make sure every customer feels valued and cared for. It's rare to find a team so genuinely committed to ensuring a positive experience. The service is always friendly, fast, and professional – no request is too much trouble.

The facilities are also excellent – clean, well-maintained, and convenient. Whether it's a quick coffee or a longer stay, this branch provides everything you need for a comfortable and enjoyable visit.

I've been to many Barista locations, but this one by far offers the most pleasant and memorable experience. Highly recommended to anyone looking for great coffee, amazing staff, and a peaceful ambiance. Kudos to the whole team – keep up the fantastic work!

address: 631 Puttalam - Colombo Rd, Negombo 11410, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I'm a Software Architect working remotely for an overseas company and based in Seeduwa, about 10–15 km away from Negombo. Whenever I have work or errands in Negombo, Barista is my go-to spot. I often settle in here with a coffee and catch up on work—especially helpful when I don’t have time to head back home or to the office.

Sometimes, I also choose to work from Barista just to switch up the environment and recharge my mood. It helps reduce stress and boosts productivity. When I visit Negombo with my family, it’s also our favorite place to relax. Our usual orders? An Americano for me, a Caramel Macchiato for my wife, and an Oreo Shake for my son!

The café is always clean and well-maintained, the atmosphere is peaceful, and the staff are extremely friendly and attentive. Even the customers who frequent the place are respectful, which adds to the comfort.

One special thing that stood out to me was how this Barista branch takes extra care with their sanitary facilities, including providing sanitary pads in the restrooms. That level of consideration shows how much they care about their customers' well-being. It's a thoughtful initiative that more outlets—and public places—should follow.

Manager Dhanushka is a humble, pleasant, and practical person who, along with his team, always prioritizes customer convenience. I’ve visited many Barista branches across the country, but the Negombo branch truly stands out as the best.

If I could give more than 5 stars, I would. Keep up the amazing service, Barista Negombo!

address: 48, IBM Building, Nawam Mawatha, Colombo 00200, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Barista Nawam Mawatha has become one of my favorite coffee spots in Colombo. The atmosphere is calm and modern—perfect whether you’re meeting friends, working, or just enjoying some time alone. The staff are friendly, attentive, and always greet you with a smile.

Their coffee is consistently good. I usually go for a cappuccino or iced latte, and both are rich and well-balanced. They also offer vegan milk options, which is a big plus for those who prefer plant-based choices. The food menu is decent too—I’ve tried a couple of their sandwiches and pastries, and they’ve been fresh and tasty every time.

The space is clean and comfortable, with plenty of seating and good Wi-Fi, which makes it a great place to sit down with your laptop if needed. It does get a bit busy during peak hours, but it’s never too overwhelming.

Overall, I’d definitely recommend Barista Nawam Mawatha to anyone looking for a relaxing place with quality coffee and a welcoming vibe.

review_text: Brand new outlet in the buzzing commercial area of Navam Mawatha. Great place to sit down enjoy a good cup of coffee and relax. This outlet is equipped with a table friendly for working on laptops. It has USB charging ports and additional power sockets to charge up your machine while doing some work at the cafe. The front two chairs are comfy and ideal for reading with good lighting and in close proximity to the main area of the outlet. All chairs have charging outlets in close proximity to them. The sofa area is great if you are meeting up with a few friends and catching up with them. They are comfortable and the ambient lighting amplifies the feel and look of the outlet. You can chose to sit inside or outside depending on your preference specially if you require a smoking area you can smoke outside and have a shot of espresso. Outlet team is very friendly with outlet manager Huzny heading the crew along with Navam Mawatha  outlet crew Haritha, Kavindya Jithma and rest of the crew members.

address: 631 Puttalam - Colombo Rd, Negombo 11410, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I am a dedicated customer at this wonderful coffee shop. The ambience is very comfortable, and I sit for hours to do my work and Zoom meetings. The coffee is excellent, but most important the staff are super friendly and professional.

Danushka is one of the top managers of any F&B outlet I've ever seen. His warmth and friendliness is the kind that can never be taught. He's a natural "people person" and I can see how he manages his young crew members with kindness and patience.

Ashik, Abdulla, Umayanga, Sasanka, Vinoli, Nethanka -- the whole team -- are without exception friendly, hardworking, and here's the big word -- gracious.

I work/travel all over the world, and I can say without hesitation that the Negombo Barista shop is one of the best I've had the privilege of visiting. I am grateful to them, and always look forward to every visit.

Keep up the great work!

review_text:
Stopped by Barista Negombo for a quick coffee break and was pleasantly surprised. The atmosphere is warm and inviting—cozy seating, chill background music, and a nice mix of indoor and outdoor space. Whether you’re here to work, catch up with a friend, or just enjoy some alone time with a good cup of coffee, it’s got the right vibe.

I had a cappuccino, and it was spot on—rich, smooth, and perfectly balanced. You can tell they take their coffee seriously. The cheesecake was a great pairing—light, creamy, and not overly sweet.

Service was friendly and efficient, with the staff being welcoming but not overbearing. The place was clean, well-maintained, and had a relaxed energy overall. Definitely a solid spot for coffee lovers in Negombo. Looking forward to coming back!

I like this Barista cafe...the slowness of service is slow, slow. Please bring me my coffee first.
It is a chill place..with couples on the sofas and cyber heads on their laptops.
And there is an outdoor coffee table for the smokers.
Hondhai.

But please please can you deliver your coffee.. faster .
Everything else is ok..
The delay on a coffee is just tedious.
The Air Con is super. It's nicely cool.
As far as I know Barista coffee employees do a course on coffee.
Here are 2 vital points..how long till the customer orders a coffee ,to receiving it. Surely it can be sped up.
And the ruination of a coffee is that it is lukewarm...due to the milk not being hot enough.
This is a class A hot tasty cup of Coffee.

address: 17 Pagoda Rd, Nugegoda 10250, Sri Lanka
review_text:
We Visited this outlet and ordered some food and drinks. The order took unusually long. The cashier said the order had not been placed, while the girl who took the order earlier said it would just take some time — which was quite confusing.

When I asked for the bill, both of them looked at each other suspiciously and said there was a “technical problem” and that bills couldn’t be issued, even though other customers were getting theirs. When I asked to speak with the manager, a person named Sahan said he was the manager and told us that if we didn’t like the service, we could leave.

This was a very disappointing experience. I strongly suggest that Barista management look into this matter before further actions are considered.

review_text:
This Barista branch in Nugegoda has quickly become my go-to place for everything. Whether I’m unwinding after a long day, spending quality time with my husband, catching up with friends, working, or studying, this place has it all.

What I love most about it is the peaceful and relaxing atmosphere. The friendly staff always make me feel welcome, and the cozy yet spacious interior creates a calming vibe. The modern design adds a touch of elegance, making it an inviting place to be.

With two floors available, there’s ample space to accommodate a crowd without feeling crowded. The upper floor features a pool table and an outdoor smoking area. And, of course, the coffee and food are consistently up to the high standards I’ve come to expect from Barista.

In short, this Barista branch truly lives up to its reputation and has become an essential part of my daily routine. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a great place to relax, work, or socialize!

address: 17 Pagoda Rd, Nugegoda 10250, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Barista Diner in Nugegoda has become my go-to spot, not only for coffee but also for peace of mind. As a regular customer, I often visit to study and relieve stress, and this place never disappoints. Their Americano, in particular, is my favorite — it always leaves me feeling calm and refreshed.

The team here is outstanding, and the credit goes to the manager, Mr. Dinesh, who is both professional and genuinely kind. He greets everyone warmly, whether you’re there for hours or just a short visit, and his friendly leadership keeps the branch feeling vibrant and welcoming.

Special mention also goes to Mr. Shivashanth, whose service is fast, attentive, helpful and thoughtful. He always knows how to balance professionalism with friendliness. Mr. Pasindu is also extremely helpful and approachable, ensuring every customer feels valued.

The rest of the staff are equally professional, cheerful, and consistently welcoming. The female staff members, in particular, never fail to greet customers with warm smiles that truly brighten your day and make any stress fade away.

With top-notch hospitality, delicious coffee, and an atmosphere that perfectly blends comfort and positivity, Barista Diner in Nugegoda is highly recommended. Go and experience it for yourself — you’ll want to come back again and again! ❤️✨
