address: 17 Pagoda Rd, Nugegoda 10250, Sri Lanka
review_text:
My family and I visited this coffee shop today, and while there were some things to like, the experience ultimately left us disappointed. The atmosphere is genuinely nice, and the customer support was excellent, but honestly, you expect those things when you're paying a premium.

The most important part of a coffee shop is the coffee itself, and this is where it fell completely flat. The prices are extremely high—the smallest cup of coffee starts at 500 rupees, plus a 300 rupees service charge. For that price, we were hoping for a rich, flavorful experience, but what we got was just bitter. No one in our family enjoyed it, and for such a small serving, the price feels unjustified. It feels like they have huge profit margins on a product that doesn't deliver on quality. We even signed up for their loyalty program, hoping for some good offers, but were disappointed to find there were no vouchers or discounts to be had. It's frustrating when other restaurants give you big discounts without any membership at all.

To put the prices into perspective, you could go to an international fast-food chain and get better food, service, and atmosphere for the same price. While the ambiance and service are good, they're not enough to make up for the core product being so poor and overpriced.

review_text: As I am a daily barista customer, whenever I go, I usually go to every place where the barista is, and I had to face such a horrible incident in pagoda road barista. When me, my husband and the baby went there, there was no space upstairs, and we sat close to the restroom. So, while my hubby was in a meeting, I waited with my daughter and I noticed some teenage boys were going to the washroom every time and stammering something. Earlier, I ignored it, but then recently one boy went, and two boys again ran there and talked to him like he had taken drugs or some kind of thing which was dangerous. Then, after some time, the same 2 guys went inside the washroom and locked the door. I was quite uncomfortable because, these days, teenage kids are used to being baristas, and they study and have some of their time. Btw, they get badly influenced by such things because no one notices this and no one can do anything here.as a mom, I know my kids are also coming here, so I spoke to the staff and asked them to check and mean time. I spoke to the person who they had mentioned on the board with a name and a phone number. When I spoke to him, he was like," That's not my business. Different kinds of people are coming here, so it's not an issue for him. Btw, as a responsible citizen, I don't agree with this kind of stuff. Please be careful when you send your kids there because they might get badly influenced at any time.

address: 17 Pagoda Rd, Nugegoda 10250, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Visited Barista Nugegoda on a Saturday afternoon for a meeting. The area was under a power cut, and while the café was packed to capacity, the coffee machine was down. Staff mentioned they’d get our coffee “as soon as possible” — 1.5 hours later, still nothing. Only when we were leaving did someone rush out asking if we wanted the coffee to-go.

Turns out, Barista was running on a weak generator that couldn’t even power the coffee machine — all it did was churn out thick black smoke. This wasn’t communicated to us at any point, and we wasted time waiting for something they couldn’t deliver.

On top of that, the café was overcrowded, noisy, and there was barely space. Definitely not the place for a proper meeting or even a relaxed coffee. Management needs to seriously rethink the setup and customer experience.

27 S. De S. Jayasinghe Mawatha, Nugegoda 10250, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I have been a patron at Barista over a decade now. However, I have stopped going to Barista due to their exorbitant prices. In addition they Charge 10% of the bill value for packaging when you take-away even while visiting a store.

I have sent a personal message to CEO Dilupa in this regard. However, I believe the only way that people respond is when things get highlighted publicly, which is unfortunate, I reckon.

Are you specifically a Dine-In only Café? if not why 10% packaging?? Does your brown paper bag cost 10% of your product price? If so you should change the supplier, instead of burdening the customer.

I am so done with these businesses in Sri Lanka who thinks they can do whatever. You should travel the world and see how a sustainable business operates.

I know you will not change and will not mind losing a single customer. For me I rather go to starred hotel for more overall experience, rather scratching my head to find a parking spot at our esteemed Store! (Any store in that matter)

I have bills in case any one wants to peruse.

review_text:

address: No 601, Delkanda, Nugegoda 10250, Sri Lanka
review_text:
We visited Barista Delkanda and initially found there were no seats available. That’s when we were greeted by Mr. Thisith, who quickly made things work by adding a chair to a two seater arrangement simple, thoughtful, and very much appreciated.

We ordered a hot chocolate, ham and cheese Turkish simit, iced caramel macchiato, and a Milo shake. Everything was delicious as always. However, things took an unexpected turn when we accidentally spilled the entire hot chocolate all over the table and floor a complete mess.

I went up to the cashier to let Mr. Thisith know what had happened. He immediately came over, cleaned the area, and handled the situation with such understanding and kindness that it completely took away the awkwardness of the moment. After the cleanup, I went back to order another hot chocolate, since I hadn’t tasted a drop before the spill, but they insisted it was on them and gave me a new one for free.

That small but meaningful gesture absolutely nailed their tagline "Brewing Happiness". The atmosphere here is stunning, and the customer service goes far beyond expectations.

A must visit cafe in Colombo. Huge thanks to Mr. Thisith and the Barista management for taking the cafe experience to the next level.

review_text: One of the most spacious outlets in the Barista chain. You don't have to worry about parking plenty of parking slots available with a security guard also available to help you out while parking. Seats are very comfortable. Great place to hangout with friends or family or if you are a freelancer you can work at 2 designated areas with USB charging and plug point available tables. All items offered by Barista is also available at this outlet. Very clean toilets. An Outdoor Area is available if you are looking for a smoking area. Outlet has around 50 to 100 seating capacity. Good reading lights available if you enjoy reading along with a cup of coffee like me. It is actually an outlet that promotes and contributes towards reading, there are good books available to read in the sofa area on your right hand side as soon as you enter the premise. Large/High capacity AC units available to keep you nice and cool. Staff was friendly. Interior looks modern at the same time functional. I would recommend this outlet to anyone without any problem on anyday of the week.

address: No 601, Delkanda, Nugegoda 10250, Sri Lanka
review_text:
This is the newest and biggest Barista outlet between Delkanda and Wijerama Junction — and it’s impressive!

First impression: the parking! Finally, a café with plenty of space to park, and the security staff handles it really well. The moment you walk in, the interior is stunning – spacious, calm, and beautifully designed. It’s more than just a coffee shop; it feels like a cozy lounge or a second home.

The vibe is super relaxed. You’ll see couples chatting, students studying, and office teams working or meeting clients. The atmosphere is quiet, welcoming, and comfortable – perfect for both work and catch-ups.

The staff is warm and professional, making you feel truly welcome. After we finished our time there with chats, coffee, sandwiches, and cake, they even said, “Have a good day, sir. Please come again!” – a nice personal touch.

This was my second visit, and I’ll definitely be going again to work, meet friends, or have casual meetings. As always, coffee at Barista never disappoints.

Tip: Stick to their hot beverages – they’re great. Skip the cold drinks or juices, as those taste like regular store-bought ones.
Highly recommend trying their shrimp and pol sambol sandwich – absolutely delicious!

address: No 601, Delkanda, Nugegoda 10250, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Barista Delkanda is a cozy, vibrant space with beautiful interiors. It’s co-work friendly and a great spot to relax or get some work done. Coffee’s good, and the staff is friendly.

That said, I ran into two small issues. First, they mixed up our order—asked for a hot and iced Americano, but got a latte instead. We were okay with it, and they did offer to replace it, which was nice.

Second, while I was using the washroom, my half-finished iced Americano was mistakenly cleared. Again, staff apologized and offered to make a new one, but we were in a rush.

It seems like a new team still learning the ropes. No major complaints, just hope the service tightens up with time. I’d visit again.

review_text:
Barista Orion City, located inside Orion City in Dematagoda, is a cozy and welcoming café perfect for coffee lovers and those looking for a work friendly spot. The coffee is rich and flavorful, and they offer a variety of beverages and light snacks. The service is good, and the place is clean, well maintained, and comfortable.

They have both indoor and outside seating, with plug points available for working. Free and paid parking options make it convenient. They also have plugged vaporizers to control mosquitoes, though a few may still be present. Overall, it’s a great place to enjoy coffee, work, or hang out with friends in a relaxed environment.

We had a terrible experience at this place. We wanted to pre-order a cheesecake for my mom’s birthday and visited the shop three days in advance. The manager told us that there was no need to place a pre-order and assured us that a cheesecake would be available on the day we needed it.

We returned today as planned, only to be told that there was no cheesecake in stock and that we should have placed an order beforehand. After that, they said they might be able to provide one later in the evening.

This shows very poor communication and service. I would not recommend this barista to anyone.

review_text: My wife and I hung around this place while we were waiting for our friends. We had a Caramel latte and some kinda of Milo Shake and a bagel with chicken. I have to say the food and the drinks were really amazing. It was so refreshing and energising since we're tired from walking around. The atmosphere here is really calming, and it's like you're entering a different world. It's quiet and a good place to hang out with someone. Inside is really spacious, and lots of foreigners and locals were present there. I have been to a few other Barista locations. I have to say this is the best out of all. Would really like to visit here again. Also, they have plenty of parking and outside seating available. I went during the morning and it was a bit cold outside, but inside was well insulated and a bit warmer than outside.

review_text:
Nuwaraeliya Barista is an amazing venue that truly stands out. The interior design is beautiful – easily one of the most aesthetically pleasing Barista outlets I've visited.
What impressed me most is how spacious it is, offering various types of seating areas so you can choose the perfect spot to enjoy your coffee. Whether you prefer a cozy corner or an open space, there's something for everyone. For those looking to work, there are convenient power outlets to plug in your laptop.
The service is commendable. Even though I visited during a busy period, the staff worked with full commitment to efficiently handle all customer orders.
Don't miss the outdoor seating – the tables and chairs outside let you sip your coffee while enjoying the cool, refreshing breeze. A perfect spot to relax and unwind!

address: Greenways, Badulla Rd, Nuwaraeliya 22200, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Barista Nuwara Eliya is one of the most relaxing spots in the hill country ☕. The cozy interior paired with the cool Nuwara Eliya climate makes it the perfect place to unwind. The coffee is rich and aromatic, and the food is fresh and tasty every time.

What makes this café truly special is the live piano music  – it creates such a soothing and magical atmosphere that you can’t help but sit back and enjoy the moment. It really elevates the whole experience and makes Barista stand out from other cafés in town.

The staff are warm and friendly, making sure every guest feels welcome. The only drawback is that parking is limited to about 10–12 vehicles, so it can be a bit tricky to find a spot during busy hours. But once you step inside, the comfort and vibe make it worth the effort.

Definitely a must-visit for anyone exploring Nuwara Eliya – whether for a quick coffee, a chat with friends, or just to enjoy the music and atmosphere in “Little England” ✨

address: 455 A2, Panadura, Sri Lanka
review_text: When I first visited Barista Panadura many months ago, I was a bit annoyed, as I was comparing the serving team to other Barista outlets. However, the Panadura outlet has significantly improved its service delivery. They are now much more efficient in handling dine-in orders and are very proactive in clearing tables for the next customer once the previous one leaves. The staff has always been friendly and courteous from day one. I am very happy with the food and beverages I have had so far. Allowing customers to work until closing time is a huge plus. The only suggestion I have is to reduce the volume of the music or switch to instrumental music, which would not disturb work or conversations.

review_text:
I come here 1-2 times a week and it’s my favorite cafe. The staff is exceptionally friendly and welcoming and I like the location and vibe a lot. I’ve rated it 5 stars for everything but I have a couple of suggestions that I would love to see implemented:

Suggestions:
1. Have mosquito repellent in the no smoking outside area after 5pm

address: No, 136/B, Kandy Road, Kalalpitiya, Pasyala 11890, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Such a Nice Surprise at Barista Pasyala!

We walked into Barista Pasyala just a few minutes before closing, honestly expecting the staff to be a bit tired or ready to pack up—but not at all! Madushan and Janashakthi were super friendly, welcoming, and so accommodating even that late in the day. Their warmth really made our visit.

The food was good too. We had croissant sandwiches and they were delicious—crispy on the outside, soft and fluffy inside. Simple, fresh, and full of flavour.

The ambience was lovely as well—comfy sofas, airy spaces, and a relaxed vibe that made us want to stay longer.

All in all, such a lovely experience. We’ll definitely be back. Huge thanks again to Madushan, Janashakthi and the rest of the crew that we met later for the great service!

review_text: Barista is an exceptional coffee destination known for its warm ambiance, combining modern and rustic decor that creates a cozy atmosphere. The coffee quality is outstanding, with freshly roasted beans and expertly brewed drinks that cater to all tastes, from classic espressos to unique specialty lattes. The staff is friendly and attentive, providing prompt service and personalized recommendations, making each visit feel special. The menu offers a diverse selection, including teas, smoothies, and fresh pastries that pair beautifully with the coffee. While prices are slightly higher than average, the quality and experience justify the cost. Overall, Barista is a must-visit for coffee lovers seeking a delightful experience.

With a bit more attention to speed and operational flow, Barista Pepiliyana could easily elevate its offering and customer experience.

address: Colombo road, Pepiliyana - Dehiwela Rd, 10290, Sri Lanka
review_text:
First, the coffee was quite disappointing. The coffee machine seemed to be out of tune, and the taste was noticeably off. It was not just my opinion; most people in our group who ordered different drinks felt the same way. I ordered a single shot, which is usually simple enough to get right, but even that tasted strange. One of us had an iced Americano, and it looked and tasted different from what we are used to as well.

On a positive note, the customer service was decent. The staff were polite and attentive, so there was nothing wrong in that area.

When it comes to the atmosphere, the place did not really feel like the usual Barista experience. Normally, Barista cafés have a cozy and inviting vibe, but this location felt different. I am not sure if the management is trying a new approach or if it was just an off day, but the space felt too tight and cramped. When it gets crowded, it becomes very noisy because the tables are placed very close together, making it difficult to have a proper conversation.

I heard they are planning to expand the space in the future. Hopefully, once that happens, the overall experience will improve.

For now, it is an okay spot if you happen to be nearby and just want a quick coffee, but it is not a place I would purposely choose to visit again until some changes are made.

address: 188 Colombo - Horana Rd, Piliyandala 10300, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Great Time at Barista Piliyandala
Visited Barista Piliyandala and honestly, I’m really happy about the experience. The place has a calm and clean vibe — perfect to sit and relax. Staff was very friendly and gave good service without any delay.

I ordered a cappuccino and a blueberry cheesecake. The coffee was strong and smooth, just the way I like it. The cake was fresh and not too sweet — very satisfying. I really enjoyed the taste and the presentation as well.

The prices were fair for the quality, and overall I felt it was totally worth it. I’ll definitely come back again. Barista Piliyandala is now one of my favourite coffee spots in the area!

188 Colombo - Horana Rd, Piliyandala 10300, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Barista is a fantastic little spot that never disappoints. The ambiance is cozy and modern — perfect for catching up with friends, getting some work done, or just relaxing with a great cup of coffee. The staff are always friendly, polite, and attentive, which makes the experience even better.

Their coffee is consistently top-notch, especially the cappuccino and caramel macchiato. I also love their selection of snacks and desserts — the brownies and croissants are a must-try! Cleanliness and hygiene are well-maintained, and there’s ample seating both indoors and outdoors.

Highly recommended if you’re in the area and looking for a calm, welcoming café with great vibes and even better coffee!

address: 188 Colombo - Horana Rd, Piliyandala 10300, Sri Lanka
review_text: The staff was very friendly and accommodating, taking the time to adjust my sandwich and latte to meet dietary needs. However, it’s disappointing that some of the vegetable options on the menu aren’t vegan-friendly, especially since Sri Lanka has so much potential for delicious plant-based meals with a local twist. The coffee, unfortunately, didn’t taste great. Upon arrival, we were directed upstairs, and it felt more like a library than a coffee shop — dark, quiet, and filled with students studying at nearly every table. We struggled to find a place to sit, as single students were occupying tables meant for four, which was frustrating. It’s a coffee shop, not a library. Given the experience, I won’t be returning.

review_text:
Ive been to many many Baristas, and this is exactly the same- just perfect.

 Food: perfect.

 Speed of service: fantastic

 Staff: 10/10 super friendly and kind

 Interior: VERY spacious- 2 floors and plenty of seats

 Charging situation: 10/10! Lots and lots of charging space all over the barista. Pretty sure almost every table has its own charging port.

 Parking: there’s parking enough for like 3 cars

 Music: a tiny bit loud, so I don't think its the most ideal place to take work meetings. But it's the perfect spot to chill.

So overall, 11/10. My usual spot is cafe mocha at stratford but this might be my new go-to!

WV84+3F3, 181, 02 Sir James Peiris Road, Colombo 00200, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Barista offers a delightful escape for coffee connoisseurs and casual drinkers alike. The ambiance is modern and inviting, creating a perfect space to unwind or catch up with friends. The coffee menu is extensive, catering to various tastes with options ranging from classic espresso to innovative cold brews. Their baristas are knowledgeable and passionate, ensuring each cup is crafted to perfection.

While the coffee steals the show, Barista also offers a tempting selection of pastries and light bites. The food complements the coffee beautifully, making it a complete experience. The service is generally efficient and friendly, adding to the overall positive atmosphere. Whether you're a solo coffee enthusiast or looking for a relaxed hangout spot, Barista is definitely worth a visit.
I tried Matcha this time.

review_text:
I recently visited Barista Rajagiriya for an official meeting. The atmosphere is really nice — a perfect place for work, meetings, or just to relax with a good coffee.

We ordered blueberry cheesecake, chocolate cheesecake, cappuccino, and caramel macchiato — all were absolutely delicious and nicely presented.

review_text:
I stopped in at Barista Sigiriya after climbing the rock — it turned out to be the perfect break. The coffee was rich and well-made, the cakes and sandwiches fresh and tasty. The staff were warm, polite and spoke good English, making me feel welcome.
The vibe inside is calm and clean, great air-conditioned shelter from the heat with space to relax. One little caveat: seating is limited and parking isn’t easy, so it’s best if you don’t have a large vehicle.
If you’re in Sigiriya for the sights, stop here for a quality coffee and a pleasant rest — highly recommended!

address: 121/A Main Road, Sigiriya 21120, Sri Lanka
review_text:
We stopped at Barista Sigiriya on our way to Dambulla for a quick coffee and snack with friends. It was a very good experience overall. Just like other Barista branches, the service here was professional and friendly. The staff were polite, quick, and helpful no difference in quality even though this is in a tourist area.

The place has a calm and quiet atmosphere. The interior is nicely done clean, cozy, and good for a quick break or even to sit down and chill for a while. Whether you’re traveling or staying nearby, this is a great spot to pause and refresh.

The menu is familiar all the usual coffee options, plus some snacks and small meals. Our coffee and food were well prepared and tasted great. Prices are reasonable too, especially considering it’s in a popular location near Sigiriya.

If you’re passing through or exploring the area, I’d recommend this place. It’s consistent with what you’d expect from Barista. Good coffee, good service, peaceful vibe. Worth the stop.

address: 736 Dr Danister De Silva Mawatha, Colombo, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Barista at Maligawatta continues to uphold the high standards of food quality that the brand is known for. Every item is fresh, flavorful, and well-prepared, making it a great spot for a satisfying coffee break or light meal.

The environment is cozy and inviting, offering a comfortable space to relax or catch up with friends. It’s a welcoming spot that feels just right for both casual visits and quick work sessions.

The staff are kind and caring, providing attentive service that adds to the overall pleasant experience. Their warm attitude definitely stands out and enhances the customer experience.

One area that needs attention, however, is the washing area. Currently, it lacks basic hygiene essentials like soap and a drying facility, which can be inconvenient for guests. Addressing this would significantly improve the overall experience and align it better with Barista’s otherwise high standards.

Overall, a great place with delicious offerings and friendly service—just a small improvement needed to make it even better.

review_text: I had a disappointing experience at Barista Panadura today. Even pickup orders were heavily delayed – I waited 40 minutes just for three rice dishes. review_text:
Barista easily ranks within the top 5 best cafes in Sri Lanka. The rich aroma of coffee instantly draws you in, while the peaceful ambience makes it a perfect place to unwind. It’s an ideal spot to focus on your studies, office work, or simply relax for hours, all while enjoying premium coffee and delicious snacks.

Their coffee selection is top-notch, with high-quality brews. During our visit, we tried Spanish latte, Caffe mocha and Hot chocolate.The Spanish latter was exceptional, offering a rich flavor blending milk, caramel and cofee. The Mocha and Hot chocolate were undoubtedly authentic.

As for the customer service, Barista delivers one of the best experiences I’ve encountered, which helps maintain its reputation as a leader among cafes in Sri Lanka. If you haven’t visited Barista yet, it’s a must-try. Looking forward to visiting again soon.❤️

review_text:
Exceptional Coffee Experience at Barista Panadura!

Barista has always set the benchmark for premium coffee experiences, and their Panadura outlet takes it to the next level! From the moment you step in, you’re welcomed by a friendly and professional crew who truly understand customer service. Their warmth and attentiveness make every visit special.

What sets this outlet apart is its unique interior design—different from other Barista locations, yet maintaining the same cozy and inviting atmosphere. Whether you’re looking for a quiet spot to work, catch up with friends, or simply enjoy a perfectly brewed coffee, this place delivers on all fronts.

With Barista expanding island-wide, it’s great to see them maintaining their signature quality and service while also adding distinctive touches to each branch. Highly recommended for all coffee lovers!

Tip :
My preferred combination is Café Mocha (Medium) & Smoked Chicken WB—the best choice!

address: 55 A, Rajagiriya, Buthgamuwa Rd, Colombo 10107, Sri Lanka
review_text:
We recently visited the Rajagiriya branch to celebrate our brother’s one-month wedding milestone with a small family gathering. From the moment we arrived, the staff truly stood out for their warm hospitality. They greeted us with genuine smiles, were attentive to every detail, and tailored the entire experience to meet our needs.

A special mention goes to Sanjaya, who was exceptionally courteous and professional throughout. The same appreciation goes to Dinesh, Nimsara, Malith, Kusan, and Venistor; each of them played a part in making our time memorable with their outstanding service and sincere care.

We had a wonderful time as a family in a cozy, welcoming atmosphere, and we sincerely thank the entire team for making it so special.

Keep up the spectacular work!

address: 55 A, Rajagiriya, Buthgamuwa Rd, Colombo 10107, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Where do I start?

Do NOT order the Almond Milk unless you are okay with the flavor of almond essence. It's their standard... can't complain.

But I'll never order it again.

They were trying to be nice to replace my drink. But I never got it. Ended up paying Rp 3,000/- but drinking a sip and leaving there with an lingering awful aftertaste and hole in my pocket and a emptiness in my caffeine deprived nervous system.

Best thing I did was walk away - I'll never be entering a Barista ever again.

PS One of their videos on the wall behind them had a video of a smiling barista picking at her band-aid. Something their marketing dept missed.

review_text:
The coffee here is great. My favorite is the café latte because it has more milk and less cream. I also enjoy an espresso sometimes, depending on my mood. They provide half sugar packets with the coffee, which is a nice touch.

As for food, the croissant sandwich is a good choice. I recommend the smoked chicken one.

If you like to smoke, you can sit at the outdoor tables. There are two tables outside, each with four chairs.

address: 736 Dr Danister De Silva Mawatha, Colombo, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Orion City’s Barista is a hidden gem within the bustling tower complex, offering a perfect retreat for coffee lovers and professionals alike. This cozy café provides a warm and inviting atmosphere, making it an ideal spot for a morning coffee, a quick bite, or even a casual meeting.

The quality of the coffee is exceptional, with a rich selection of brews that cater to all tastes. Whether you prefer a strong espresso or a creamy latte, the baristas here have mastered the art of crafting the perfect cup. The pastries and snacks are equally delightful, providing the perfect complement to your drink.

In addition to the great coffee, the location within Orion City adds to its charm. Being surrounded by offices, shops, and other amenities makes it a convenient stop for both workers and visitors. It’s a place where you can take a break from the hustle and bustle of the city, enjoy a relaxing drink, and recharge for the rest of your day.

Overall, Orion City Barista is a must-visit for anyone in the area. The combination of excellent coffee, friendly service, and a comfortable setting makes it a standout spot within Orion City.

address: No 444 Colombo Road, Seeduwa 11410, Sri Lanka
review_text:
We recently visited your Seeduwa branch for the first time and were impressed by the overall ambiance. However, we would like to share a concern regarding our order of smoked beef sandwiches with cheese.
Initially, the cheese was missing, and after we had already taken a few bites, the sandwiches were taken back and returned to us with cheese added. While we appreciate the quick response, we felt that reusing the same partially eaten sandwiches and simply replacing the plate does not meet proper hospitality and food safety standards.

address: Eagle's View Point, Shanthipura, Nuwara Eliya 22200, Sri Lanka
review_text:
We visited this Barista during the festival days, and unfortunately, the overall experience wasn’t very pleasant due to the heavy traffic and large crowds in the area. However, this was not the fault of Barista itself.

The café is located at Eagle View Point, which is a popular attraction. On holidays and festival days, it gets very crowded and noisy, as many people visit the viewpoint.

If you’re planning to visit, I’d recommend going on a weekday or during the off-season to enjoy the place more peacefully. The location has great potential—just be mindful of the timing!

address: south bound, Southern Expy, Welipenna, Sri Lanka
review_text:
This place is a terrible one to try coffee. Wanted to write this as it happened twice, and decided not to visit this place. The coffee served here is far worse. I was a regular customer at Barista about 1 and a half years back and stopped visiting it after they started opening many, many outlets with lesser quality coffee.

Since the only available coffee place in the service area, I visited this place again, thinking whether they have improved, and ordered 2 double chocolate frappes and two other hot coffees for my friends. Everybody rejected drinking as there was no taste in these. And it two frappes were too sugary. It is a waste of money to buy from this place, as we cannot get a quality coffee at all. This is the second time I've faced the same thing from this place. Please do not cheat your customers. Anybody who wishes to visit this place should think twice. Probably anyone can get a Nescafé from any other shop, which is far better than this place's coffee.

Until then, I’m hesitant to return or recommend this branch.

review_text:
If you’re looking for a coffee stop while driving down the southern expressway, this is pretty much the only spot worth mentioning. Quality’s on par with other Barista outlets — still stuck in that outdated Italian first wave vibe, with a few second wave drinks thrown in. But yeah, expect over-extracted, dark roast beans with not much flavour.

review_text:
Fantastic Experience at Barista!
I recently visited "Barista" and had an amazing time! The "Chicken Ham & Cheese Croissant Sandwich" was an absolute delight from the first bite to the last. The flavors were impeccable, and it left me craving for more.
Accompanying my meal was a delicious Blueberry Frappe, which was not only refreshing but packed with the perfect blend of flavors. It complemented the sandwich perfectly.
The ambiance of the shop was exceptional. It was spotless and had a wonderful vibe, making my visit even more enjoyable. The staff was friendly and attentive, adding to the overall positive experience.
I will definitely be returning to "Barista" for more of their scrumptious offerings. Highly recommend to all coffee and food enthusiasts!

Service Area B, Southern Expy, Welipenna 12108, Sri Lanka
Service Area B, Southern Expy, Welipenna 12108, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Oh dear, not the normal Barista experience here. I get that this is more of an express shop over relaxed coffee shop experience, but did feel a bit cheated here.

First at the time (circa 11am) there was 2 staff members visible. A little queue of customers then saw the order screen which promoted get 20% off and save time from queues and money.

Order 2 cappuccinos, and then the breakdown showed 20% off, but 10% packaging charge! erm, so thats 10% off not 20% off ...Lie number 1. Then waited 10 mins, and still no coffee, spoke to the Barista and asked how long, he said another 10 mins, 20 20 mins waiting for 2 coffees, did not save time...lie number 2.

Coffee was good, but management should be more transparent and staff these joints more effectively by seeing the data of how many customers they need to serve at peak times.

address: Service Area B, Southern Expy, Welipenna 12108, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I’m not someone who usually goes to Barista often, but something happened and I feel I need to inform you about it. On 2025/11/23, I visited this outlet and noticed there was a kiosk machine with the tagline ‘SKIP THE LINE & SAVE TIME!’. Because of that, I decided not to purchase in the normal way and instead placed my order through the kiosk. I made the payment around 5:40 pm, and I received my order at about 6:20 pm. I understand that it was a busy day, so the delay is acceptable.

However, the issue is that I selected ‘dine-in’, but my order was given to me as ‘takeaway’. When I told the employee who handed me the order, he said the outlet had run out of plates, which is why they changed it to takeaway. If that was the case, I should have been informed first, but no one told me anything.

Another thing is that a customer who came after me, and who ordered in the normal way—not through the kiosk—received their order around 6:10 pm.

So I have two concerns:

If kiosk machine orders are delayed like this, then why display a tagline like that?

The fact that the outlet didn’t have plates is not my problem, but I should have been informed beforehand.

I’ve never had any issues with any outlet before. This is the first time something like this has happened, but please make sure the staff are informed properly to avoid such situations in the future. I have attached the relevant photos.

address: Service Area B, Southern Expy, Welipenna 12108, Sri Lanka
review_text:
I ordered a medium soy cappuccino, and they charged me 950, but gave me a small. When I pointed it out, instead of remaking the drink properly, they took the small cup back, changed the cup, added another espresso and more soy milk. It tasted really bad. I expected them to make a fresh cappuccino, not mix the old one into a bigger cup.

On top of that, the drink didn’t even have the chocolate powder shown in the picture, and it didn’t even have the froth that a proper cappuccino should have.

Overall, very disappointing and far below standard.

address: 33 Staple St, Colombo 00200, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Cozy Spot with Great Service – Barista at Staple Street (Lakarcade)

I visited the Barista at Staple Street, which is located inside Lakarcade. So you enter through the main entrance of the Lakarcade building. It’s a lovely place with a warm and inviting atmosphere. You can enjoy your coffee either indoors or in the outdoor seating area, both offering a nice vibe to relax.

I ordered the Kochchi Chicken Bagel and a café mocha. Both were fresh and delicious. The staff was friendly and provided great service throughout. Definitely a nice spot to unwind or catch up with friends over coffee.

One great thing is that it’s also a good spot to work. The atmosphere is calm and comfortable, making it suitable for working while enjoying your coffee.

Definitely a place I’d recommend and visit again!

The staff—Aathiq,Dinuka, Vidum, Hakeem, Safna, and others—were not only professional but genuinely friendly and attentive. Their teamwork and enthusiasm create such a positive atmosphere.

review_text: It was a pleasant experience there, though it’s not quite your typical cafe. address: Battaramulla - Pannipitiya Rd, Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte, Sri Lanka
review_text:
The place is a quite old barista. But its quite nice.

The coworking situation is catered more towards solo workers rather than duos or groups who come to work together.

They have small single person sized tables (a lot of them) and some coffee tables that can accomodate groups. The tables are a bit warped and rickety but its cozy and cute.

Has 2 floors. The upper floor has quite a nice library with a good variety of books.

There is also a separated meeting room with an AC that can be rented for 2000rs per hour.

The service is good with a friendly and attentive staff.

The only issue is that the parking is a bit insufficient, we had to park on the roadside since the parking spaces were all taken up.

All in all, a nice space to work at. And would probably be an even nicer place to come with some friends who would enjoy just hanging out in silence reading a good book.

address: Battaramulla - Pannipitiya Rd, Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte, Sri Lanka
review_text:
**Barista Thalawathugoda**

Barista Thalawathugoda stands out not just for its quality coffee but also for its exceptional customer service. The ambiance is warm and inviting, with both indoor and outdoor seating options that create a relaxed and cozy atmosphere. Whether you're looking for a quick coffee stop or a comfortable space to work, this café offers a great experience.

The coffee is consistently well-prepared, with a smooth and rich taste that matches Barista’s signature quality. Their menu features a good selection of espresso-based drinks, teas, and refreshing beverages, along with light snacks, pastries, and sandwiches. While the food variety could be expanded, the existing options pair well with their drinks.

What truly sets this branch apart is the excellent service. The manager and staff go above and beyond to ensure customers feel welcome and satisfied. They are friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu, always willing to customize drinks or accommodate special requests. Even during busy hours, the team maintains efficiency while ensuring a pleasant experience.

A Hidden Gem in the Heart of Colombo!

From the moment I walked in, Barister Trillium felt like a stylish escape in the city. The ambiance is warm and modern, with just the right touch of elegance. I had their signature coffee and a pastry — both were absolutely delicious and clearly made with care. What stood out most was the attentive service; the staff were friendly, knowledgeable, and genuinely welcoming. Whether you're catching up with friends or looking for a quiet corner to work, this place offers the perfect vibe. Can’t wait to return!

address: 184, Welledewala Junction, Galle, Matara Rd, Unawatuna 80600, Sri Lanka
review_text:
Super Service !

Wir Frühstücken hier jeden Morgen, sofern es der Terminplan zulässt.

Das Honey Roasted Chicken Sandwich + Cheese können wir empfehlen. Es ist minimal Scharf und schmeckt so am besten.

Die Einrichtung sowie die Toiletten sind in einem Super Zustand.

Es gibt auch Strom, wenn man den Adapter dabei hat. Die Stühle sind super bequem.

Die Klima ist auf 23 Grad eingestellt. Kann manchmal Frisch sein, wenn man aus den Gefühlten 35 Grad rein kommt.

Der Inhaber sowie das Personal sind super nett und Sprechen gutes Englisch.

Da Barista neu sein soll, hoffe ich, dass sich die Kette vergrößert und an mehreren Touri Orten vorzufinden ist.

Idealer Ort und mal eine Pause zu machen und Spiele zu spielen. Mensch ärgere dich nicht, sowie Schach liegen unten bereit.

address: C.P.D De Silva Rd, B427, Udawalawa 70190, Sri Lanka
review_text:
We stopped at Brista in Udawalawe on our way back from visiting the Elephant Transit Home because we were craving a piece of cake. Since we were traveling with our 7-month-old baby, it wasn’t convenient to dine in, so we decided to grab and go.

However, we were shocked by the price they charged for just a takeaway slice. For a brand like this, we expected proper packaging and fair pricing, but the experience felt completely third-class. On top of that, the cake itself was a disappointment—dry, lacking moisture, and tasted like it had been sitting in the chiller for too long.

The staff were polite and friendly, but the management really needs to rethink their standards, especially when it comes to pricing, packaging, and product quality. Highly disappointed.

address: C.P.D De Silva Rd, B427, Udawalawa 70190, Sri Lanka
review_text:
arista Udawalawe is a wonderful addition to this area, especially for those visiting the Elephant Transit Home or heading towards the national park. It’s refreshing to find a place that offers the same world-class Sri Lankan coffee and food line that we are used to in Colombo and other urban areas, now available in a rural setting.

The location is excellent, making it a perfect stop to relax, refresh, and enjoy a cup of quality coffee or even a proper meal. The café is well-maintained with a clean and welcoming atmosphere, which adds to the overall pleasant experience. The service is friendly and attentive, and the staff ensure that customers feel comfortable and well looked after.

What stands out is the consistency—whether it’s a cappuccino, a quick snack, or even a main meal, the quality matches what you’d expect from Barista anywhere in Sri Lanka. It’s a brilliant idea to have a Barista outlet here, as it not only serves tourists but also adds a modern touch to Udawalawe.

Overall, it’s a great place to visit if you’re in the area. Whether you’re stopping by after an elephant safari, on a long journey, or simply looking for a reliable café, Barista Udawalawe delivers both comfort and quality.

Whether you go for a cappuccino, latte, or iced coffee, the quality and consistency truly stand out. Their baristas clearly know what they’re doing, and it shows in every sip.

address: C.P.D De Silva Rd, B427, Udawalawa 70190, Sri Lanka
184, Welledewala Junction, Galle, Matara Rd, Unawatuna 80600, Sri Lanka
review_text:
This coffee shop interior, designed with warm and inviting atmosphere through the creative use of  matt finish gold color elements to give a premium feel to the coffee  . The gold metal bars and hanging  gold installation in the double height space combine the two floors other than the stair case.
The design  enabling light to the building from every side.  The layout balances social and semi-private seating zones effectively. Large sofas and arrangements for individuals or pairs. This zoning allows the café to accommodate diverse customer needs — from casual meetups to solo work sessions.
The use of leather or leatherette sofas in light  tones gives the space a rich, grounded feel. Warm wood flooring and Burma teak -stained timber tables enhance the cozy, upscale atmosphere while remaining durable for commercial use. Orange fabric chairs and ottomans add a soft contrast, harmonizing with the café’s warm theme without overpowering it.

This café interior & exterior  successfully merges comfort, brand identity, and industrial-chic design principles. thoughtfully executed space that caters to both functionality and mood. integration of warm materials, light, greenery, and art creates a memorable and user-friendly environment .
Feeling and food is great, also the staff is very friendly.

this coffee shop interior designed with warm and inviting atmosphere through the creative use of  matt finish gold color elements to give a premium feel to the coffee   the gold metal bars and hanging  gold installation in the double height space combine the two floors other than the stair case
the design  enabling light to the building from every side  the layout balances social and semiprivate seating zones effectively large sofas and arrangements for individuals or pairs this zoning allows the café to accommodate diverse customer needs  from casual meetups to solo work sessions
the use of leather or leatherette sofas in light  tones gives the space a rich grounded feel warm wood flooring and burma teak stained timber tables enhance the cozy upscale atmosphere while remaining durable for commercial use orange fabric chairs and ottomans add a soft contrast harmonizing with the cafés warm theme without overpowering it

this café interior  exterior  successfully merges comfort brand identity and industrialchic design principles thoughtfully executed space that caters to both functionality and mood integration of warm materials light greenery and art creates a memorable and userfriendly environment 
feeling and food is great also the staff is very friendly

review_text:
Barista Coffee Unawatuna is truly an amazing spot. The outlet has a beautiful and cozy atmosphere, perfect for relaxing after a beach walk or meeting friends. The coffee is top quality rich, smooth, and perfectly brewed every time. The staff are friendly, professional, and always make you feel welcome.

Their snacks and desserts are delicious, and the service is fast even during busy hours. The cleanliness and attention to detail really stand out. One of the best coffee experiences in the South. Highly recommend this place to anyone visiting Unawatuna.
